Title: Linux System Administrator
Description:
Linux Administrator Job Description
Linux administrators are back-end IT specialists who install, configure, and maintain Linux operating systems in a variety of organizations. This role involves server-side operations and troubleshooting tasks that support business-critical and development activities. Linux administrators also configure user access and monitor system stability and security through deployment and everyday use.
This role requires extensive familiarity with Linux systems and servers and may involve a high level of risk assessment and user support. Because Linux is an open-source operating system, administrators also frequently communicate and collaborate with other developers to develop and implement system enhancements.
Linux Administrator Duties and ResponsibilitiesWhile the specific duties of a Linux administrator can vary based on their business and industry, the general responsibilities of this role are relatively consistent. Based on listings that we analyzed, these duties include:
Install and Configure Linux Systems
A Linux administrator’s main responsibility is to install and set up Linux systems and servers, often for organization-wide deployment. They develop servers and work with individual users to ensure that the system works reliably and quickly and answer questions related to setup and installation. In this role, Linux administrators also set up the architecture of the system, including back-end databases and scripts for specific applications and use cases.
Perform System Maintenance
Linux administrators also perform routine system maintenance and resolve server-side issues as they arise. This aspect of the role requires the Linux administrator to review error logs and reported errors and seek out solutions. Frequently, Linux administrators need to work directly with the system’s source code to make necessary changes to ensure reliable performance and then deploy those changes throughout the system.
Create System Backups
Linux administrators also conduct system backups according to company or industry standards. They may perform these backups weekly, daily, or more frequently depending on system space and business needs. This improves system recovery after a crash or other outage and supports data integrity by ensuring that there is never a massive loss of vital information.
Monitor System Performance
In addition to maintaining Linux systems and servers, Linux administrators also monitor system performance to prevent slowdowns and crashes. They may examine daily traffic logs and reports or receive direct reports from end users. If the Linux administrator notices potential issues or recurring problems within the system, they develop and deploy solutions so that the system remains usable for all personnel.
Provide Technical Support and Guidance
Linux administrators provide technical support and guidance to users and other administrators. In many cases, the Linux administrator works closely with other developers to answer technical questions or resolve issues with server-side performance. They may also support users by assisting with installation and maintenance of Linux-based programs and help debug these applications so that they work with existing servers.
Maintain System Security
Finally, Linux administrators maintain system security by actively identifying faults and vulnerable areas within the system’s architecture. This part of the job requires extensive knowledge of viruses and other sources of system vulnerability, and requires the Linux administrator to proactively develop protections, particularly when deploying system-wide changes that can open up new vulnerabilities.

Title: System Administrator (Mumbai)
Description:
Role Overview

As a System Administrator you will perform all duties pertaining to hardware, software, and network in accordance with defined standard operating procedures in a timely and accurate fashion. This includes installing, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining and upgrading all Core systems..
Provide end user training, support and assistance where required. Collaborates with application and infrastructure colleagues to root cause environment failures.

Responsibilities
Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor and troubleshoot end user workstation hardware, accessories, printers, networked peripheral devices, networking hardware products and phones.
Performs on-site and remote analysis, diagnosis and resolution of complex problems for a variety of end users
Recommend and implement corrective hardware solutions, including off-site repairs, as needed.
Document the work and provide “how to” guides to end-users.
Works with end users to identify and deliver required PC service levels.
Receives and responds to incoming ticketing system requests regarding PC and/or hardware and/or software problems.
Liaises with, and provides training and support to end users and staff on computer operation and other issues.
Provides analysis of current environment for ongoing hardware refresh while providing details to ensure inventory is available and to ensure smooth replenishment.
Install, configure, Maintain and Monitor Video conferencing equipments
Plan and Implement relocation of IT Equipments for end users
Inventory and Vendor Management for support

Your Profile
Associate’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
Minimum two to three years work experience of progressively responsible computer repair and system support experience
Critical thinking skills, decisive judgement and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
Able to work in a stressful environment and take appropriate action
Demonstrate effective communication skills
Customer service oriented and proactive
Fluent in English.

Main competences
Microsoft Desktop and Server Operating systems
Application Packaging
Microsoft infrastructure services (AD, Group Policy, PKI, SCCM, SCOM, SCVMM)
Mobile Device Management (Google MDM)
Powershell and Command Line Scripting (Added advantage)
Basic Understanding of networking
Inventory Management

Our cultural identity revolves around:
Treating each other with respect. We communicate in a constructive way, we respect diversity.
Encouraging creativity, innovation, new ideas and being pro-active. We support our employees in exploring new options and trying new technologies, methods and techniques, we seek continual improvement.
Leveraging each other's strengths, we share, collaborate and build on each other's knowledge, we are inclusive, we engage employees at all levels and we value time spent together.
Sharing information at all levels. We are curious and open to cultural differences, we value transparency, we promote an open-door policy: everyone is approachable by all our people, no matter their job title.

Title: Helpdesk IT Support
Description:
Helpdesk IT Support
When everything's connected, how we connect is everything.. . and we'd like to connect with you too! We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional customer experiences as a
Help Desk Support Technician
.

As a technologist, we know you're in high demand. And we know it's important you find the right fit for your future. Have ideas you want to contribute? We're listening. Looking for exposure to different clients, different technologies? It's what we do. Want to make an impact on the future? We're innovating every day. Teamwork key? You'll have the opportunity to work on global projects with a knowledge-thirsty, international team. Join our inclusive Corporate IT team and you'll help create meaningful employee experiences that drive memorable customer experiences.

The IT Support Technician's role is to consistently improve and maintain a high level of customer satisfaction by troubleshooting and providing assistance to resolve customer issues. The IT Support Technician is responsible for the logging and tracking of all Service Desk requests and for providing tier 1 and 2 technical support. The Technician will follow documented procedures for escalating the issues that are outside of their area of competency and is responsible for following up on the issue until it has been resolved. The IT Support Technicians are the primary source for endpoint support.

The IT Support Technician follows documented work instructions to accommodate customer work order requests, including creation and administration of IDs that provide access to various internal and external systems.

What you'll gain as a TTEC Help Desk Technician
Paid training on the latest technology
Fun, talented and witty teammates
Knowledgeable, encouraging and present leadership
Family-friendly environment
Free-spirited, theme-based employee events
A diverse and community-minded organization
Career growth and learning opportunities for aspiring minds
and, yes, all of the competitive pay, medical and vacation benefits you'd expect from a best-in-class global solutions provider!
What you'll be doing specifically
Answer phone and email requests for technical assistance and perform tier 1 and 2 troubleshooting and analysis.
Incident detailed documentation in Service Now or other required applications for any work they perform
Complete checklist of daily operational tasks to ensure system availability before production hours and monitor system performance
Provide setup, imaging, upgrades, repair and inventory control services for PC's at the local site
Administrate or facilitate the administration of IDs
Create and update Support Documentation
Moving or relocating workstations as required, for both small and large projects
Ability to work flexible hours and accommodate any of the IT Support Services shifts. Some overtime might be required. Ability to provide after-hours 24/7 on-call or on-site support.
The local IT Support Technicians are the primary source for daily support tasks on the production floor and are responsible for escalating to local administrators if the problem is beyond their area of expertise and responsibility.
Maintain a positive work environment that fosters team performance. Support and contribute open communications flow inside and outside the Technology Team
What you'll bring to TTEC
Post-secondary degree in a related field or equivalent work experience within the I.T. field.
Minimum of 4 years, Computer hardware and software experience in an Enterprise environment.
Experience with basic Network troubleshooting.
Experience with basic Telephony troubleshooting
Experience with Ticketing systems, preferably Service Now
Strong communication, customer service and organizational skills.
Strong problem resolution and decision-making skills.
Working knowledge of Windows 10.
Working knowledge of Outlook 2013/2016 and Office365.
A good listener with a proven ability to build relationships with all levels of staff.
Strong time management skills, attention to detail and outstanding follow-up skills.
The ability to work well under pressure with tight deadlines.
CompTIA A+ and/or CompTIA Network+ preferred but not required
About TTEC
Our 50,000+ employees help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. We were founded on one guiding principle: customer experiences that are simple, inspired, and more human deliver lasting value for everyone. Your role brings that principle to life.
Primary Location
: India-Andhra Pradesh-Hyderabad

: Information Technology

Title: System Administrator, VMware Engine
Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Bengaluru due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.
Minimum qualifications:
Experience with configuration Management tools like Ansible, Chef or Puppet.
Experience with Virtualization and Cloud hosting.
Experience with mixed operating systems (e.g., Linux, Windows, VMware ESXi).
Experience managing public cloud deployments.

Preferred qualifications:
Knowledge of L2/L3/L4 networking.
Knowledge of Operating System internals.
Knowledge of Cloud technologies, including containerization, Docker, and Kubernetes.
About the job
Systems Administrators embrace Google's motto to ensure millions of users can access the world's information without a glitch. As a Systems Administrator at Google, you own and support the needs of one of Google's server infrastructure systems. You're highly technical and work directly with other server and service owners to ensure reliability and sustainability of the Google service infrastructure as well as compliance with internal policies. Success in this role means you are able to support servers in a mixed operating system environment and work efficiently with our internal technology providers as well as other operations groups. Googlers rely on your guidance when it comes to design decisions so you'll have a direct impact in keeping the business productive.
The Google VMware Engine service enables customers running on-premises VMware workloads to seamlessly migrate to Google Cloud without having to re-architect or refactor their applications. We help customers leverage the value of existing VMware investments while maintaining operational continuity and avoiding data center management, hardware refreshes, and procurement cycles. As part of this team you will assist in launching and on-going supporting the Google VMware Engine service and infrastructure.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Manage systems using different operating systems (e.g., Linux, Windows, ESXi).
Troubleshoot system and application issues, including containerized microservices.
Investigate issues partnering closely with the SRE and the broader Engineering team.
Automate deployment, management, security.
Manage priority of issues and tickets, and participate in rotating on call schedule with other members of the team, including during weekends.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Cloud Administrator
Description: Job Description: Cloud Cost Optimization Our team is responsible for cloud resource optimization; there by ensuring optimum usage of the allocated capacity of the compute and memory. We are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer who has good analytical skills, strong practical troubleshooting skills, advanced overall systems knowledge, public clouds, provisioning tools, and programming/templating language What your day-to-day will look like: * Monitoring and identifying the cloud resource[s] utilization across multiple accounts / subscription and Regions * Building reports, propose and implement changes * Stake holder communication and Process automation * Putting everything into code * Working in close collaboration with multi-functional teams You're the person we need if you have experience with: * Containerization (we use Kubernetes) * Experience with creating and optimizing ECS clusters in AWS * Experience with Prometheus and Grafana. * Ability to use kubectl command line * Experience with APM tool such as NewRelic * Configuration tools and frameworks (we use Terraform, Helm) * Knowledge of systems (Linux, GNU tooling), networking (OSI model, DNS, routing) and virtualization vs containerization * Programming experience with Go/Bash/Python, templating languages (Jinja), and Git/Stash * High-level abstractions for system configuration and management * Public clouds; AWS/Azure/GCP (we use AWS) * Other things we value are; * Project documentation * security awareness, * Experience with CI/CD concepts * Ticketing Tools: JIRA, Service-Now Sought personality type: * Self Motivated and Innovative * Proactive, emphatic, and approachable. * Team player and problem solver. * Effective communicator. * Great attitude but a critical thinker. * Creative and open-minded.

Title: Systems Administrator SR - Kwajalein Atoll - 1540
Description:
Ready to launch your career? RGNext operates, maintains, and sustains mission-critical systems to provide safe and effective launch, testing, and tracking of Department of Defense, civil, commercial and international space lift vehicles. We support ballistic missile, guided weapon and aeronautical tests and evaluations as well as support space situational awareness operations and experiments to defend the United States to ensure our nation’s safety. Our employees serve on the forefront of global defense and space operations. We offer our team of experienced, professional employees an environment of challenging, stimulating and personally and professionally rewarding career opportunities.
This position is located at Kwajalein Atoll
Essential Functions
Install, maintain, and support multiple servers on physical and virtual platforms in support of RTS initiatives.
Responsible for contributing to the design and deployment of complex physical and virtual infrastructures.
Maintain a secure computing environment, including patching of all systems, and applying applicable STIG settings.
Contribute to the design and deployment of beneficial IT solutions to improve execution, efficiency, and capabilities.
Ensure the technical integrity of existing and future design solutions.
Perform root cause analysis and resolution for hardware and software issues.
Perform other duties as necessary.
Required Skills
Proficient shell scripting skills and understanding of systems interaction and network dependent applications and services.
Knowledge and advanced troubleshooting skills with VMware vSphere 6.x+.
Knowledge of and advanced troubleshooting skills with RHEL 5, 6, 7, and 8.
Ability to manage and troubleshoot SELinux configurations.
Secure physical and virtual machines to DISA STIG requirements.
Able to deploy, configure, and maintain RHEL systems in a mission critical environment.
Proficient documentation skills, organizational skills, and the ability to interact with team members cross-functionally.
Proficient verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient understanding of the TCP/UDP network stacks and familiar with troubleshooting via the ISO-OSI model, or similar, desired.
Skilled creating, maintaining, and deploying Ansible playbooks, desired.
Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field and/or equivalent relevant experience.
Five (5) years’ experience working in IT as a Systems Engineer or Systems Administrator.
CompTIA Security + or similar certifications meeting DoD 8570.01 IAT Level IV.
RHCSA, VMware Certified Advanced Professional, or other computing environment certification.
Experience with Red Hat Satellite.
Experience designing and deploying replicable global solutions against disparate networks, architectures, services and configurations.
Experience managing CF Engine and Centrify, desired.
Experience in Kernel level debugging with ability to read/troubleshoot various scripted languages as necessary (Bash, Python, Ruby, PowerShell, etc.), desired.
Experience sizing and rightsizing physical and virtual system resources using OS native tools (sar, mpstat, top, vmstat, iostat, etc.), desired.
Experience building security controls into new and existing solutions with strong understanding of security relevant changes and desired.
Additional Eligibility Qualifications
The flexibility to work occasional non-duty hours or on weekends to support specific project or mission requirements
This position is accompanied.
Must be able to relocate to the United States Army Kwajalein Atoll, Marshall Islands.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. passport
Must be able to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance, which includes U.S. Citizenship or U.S. naturalization
Valid U.S. Driver’s License required.
What We Offer:
Everyday Wellness: Access to on-base fitness centers, pool, bowling alley, beach access, fishing, scuba diving, snorkeling and golf course.
Financial Opportunities: 401k savings program with company match and vesting on day one, retail and merchant employee discount programs, life insurance, business travel insurance and more.
Work/Life Balance: Tuition reimbursement programs and flexible schedules.
Equal Opportunity: Commitment to diversity and strategic partnerships.
Note: This job description describes the general nature of the duties and requirements of the job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list or to limit the supervisor's ability to modify work assignments as appropriate.
RGNext is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other protected class.

Title: Network Administrator
Description:
Job Description
1) Diagnose & Troubleshoot hardware and software problems and replace defective components.

2) On site desktop support related to OS, MS Office, hardware issues, peripheral devices issues.
3) Maintain and administer computer networks and related computing environments, including computer hardware, systems software, applications software, and all configurations.

4) Plan, coordinate, and implement network security measures in order to protect data, software, and hardware.
5) Perform routine network startup and shutdown procedures, and maintain control records.

6) Design, configure, and test computer hardware, networking software and operating system software.
7) Confer with network users about how to solve existing system problems.

8) Monitor network performance in order to determine whether adjustments need to be made, and to determine where changes will need to be made in the future.

9) Train people in computer system use.
10) Verify NAS data storage and backups regularly.

11) Gather data pertaining to customer needs, and use the information to identify, predict, interpret, and evaluate system and network requirements.

12) Analyse equipment performance records in order to determine the need for repair or replacement.
13) Maintain logs related to network functions, as well as maintenance and repair records.

14) Research new technology, and implement it or recommend its implementation.

15) Maintain an inventory of parts for emergency repairs.

16) Coordinate with vendors and with company personnel in order to facilitate It related purchases.

Title: Desktop Support Engineer
Description:
The primary mission of Catchpoint CIT is to ensure our staff can work efficiently and securely across all of our global locations. This is a position for an enthusiastic, organized and competent IT support technician. You must be comfortable and have solid experience supporting users on both Windows and MAC across different locations.
Responsibilities
Provide remote and on-site troubleshooting, training and tech support to end users
Responding to user requests from all offices, following through on requests and escalating those that need attention. Good customer skills and attention to detail are a must.
Prepping machines for staff use (OS/updates/necessary software). If you have experience with images this is a plus.
Maintaining and updating inventory of all Catchpoint office assets including software
Ensure on-board and termination of employees are processed efficiently, and access granted or revoked to systems.
Learn phone system configurations and backup systems (VOIP) to enable quick response to ISP outages that may affect staff
Administer access to applications used by staff including license count.
Skills:
2-4 years of professional experience with System / Network Administration.
Windows 10, Windows Server, MAC OS
Familiarity and experience with cloud-based SaaS applications
High comfort level with network troubleshooting (traceroute, nslookup)
Familiarity with Cisco Meraki firewall and OpenDNS or equivalent
You are always learning and seeking ways to make things better.
Conscientious. You keep your promises, taking your commitments to others seriously, and you have strong integrity.
Humble. You lead with humility and empathy, respecting and learning from the perspectives of others.
Helpful. You have a passion for extraordinary customer service and helping others.
Experience with AzureAD and Zendesk is a plus

OVERVIEW:
Catchpoint is revolutionizing end-user experience monitoring to help companies deliver amazing digital experiences. Our platform provides complete visibility into your users’ experiences from anywhere – and real-time intelligence into your applications and services to detect and fix issues faster. We are proud to partner with digital innovators like Google, L'Oréal, Verizon, Oracle, LinkedIn, Honeywell, Priceline, and Qualtrics, who trust Catchpoint to improve their brand experience and drive their business success.

Title: Technical Support Professional
Description:
Introduction
You will be a CIO Identity Services – Technical Support in Bangalore (Triage Support). You will be doing Boarding support for IBM owned or 3rd party applications who want to use w3id as the Identity Provider for authenticating their users. New cloud based external identity service that provides customers of IBM an identity to digitally engage with IBM. Boarding support for IBM owned applications who want to use IBMid as the Identity Provider for authenticating their users.
Supporting solution that allows users from other companies to log in to IBM services using their own credentials. A company can use their own login page and security controls to secure access to IBM Cloud Apps or IBM Services. Enterprise Federation is available for all IBM offerings/products that use IBMid for authentication. Also, working on Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) service provides IBMers a second layer of security which powered by Duo Security SaaS offering to IBM accounts that empowers privileged users to meet the new IT Security Standard (ITSS) requirement 4.3.1.c. In depth knowledge of identity provisioning systems and IBMs legacy IBM identity tooling systemsExecutive.

Your Role and Responsibilities
w3id SSO boarding support/w3id SSO sev1 support
What is the general process for boarding IBMid
What is the SSO Provisioner tool
What are the protocols available for adopters to board
What are the most common technologies & reported issues from adopters & troubleshoot
What are the main considerations when boarding IBMid
Where are the instructions for sample scenarios
How to check status of the registrations that adopters submitted and how to update them
How to analyze authentication requests
CAPKI Support
Work with a worldwide team supporting the IBM Certificate tool that is used globally to manage wireless certificates as well as server certificates.
Address questions raised by end users.
Prioritize issues for resolution.
Enterprise Federation Support
Support external IBM Customers who wants to federate their Company with IBM. Explain what is this service, what are the boarding/integration process and guide them during all the process
Interacts with technical team (IBM and Customer) to provide them all information to help them troubleshooting
Create/update Federation request in our SSO Tool provision
2FA On-call for Weekends
Assist users to register their device with 2FaaS,
Answer users’ common questions help them to fix issues if they have any troubles.
Work as an administrator to communicate with users if their account is locked
Active user’s account if user’s account was locked by mistake.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
OS Administration
Experience with Active directory, LDAP based user id
Access/Identity management experience
Proactive/problem solving thinking
CritSit handling
SAML and OIDC concepts
IT background (degree)
Basic understanding of Agile practices
Web browsers and basic web concepts (dev tools, Cloud, HTML, HTTPS, ports, certificates, firewall). Problem-solving.
Critical Thinking Analysis & Communication Techniques. Methodical and Logical approach. Ability to plan work and meet deadlines. Accuracy and attention to details. Self-Managing. Relationship-Building.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Be familiar with Notes, Slack, Community Forums

Identity Providers: Microsoft Azure, ADFS, Okta, Putty

The IBM Finance organization is responsible for driving enterprise performance and transformation. Title: Sr System Administrator II
Description:
Overview:
At Rambus, we are turning incredible possibilities into everyday reality by helping to deliver the innovations that greatly impact the world we live in. We create leading-edge semiconductor and IP products, spanning memory and interfaces to security to smart sensors. Our products are integrated into tens of billions of devices and systems around the globe, running critical applications for Big Data, Internet of Things (IoT), mobile, consumer and media platforms.

And our history runs deep – we have been in Silicon Valley for 25+ years and are continually anticipating key technology trends and are developing innovations that drive market changes. From a pure IP provider to becoming a fabless chipmaker, Rambus is evolving to address critical challenges in the semiconductor industry.

As a dynamic organization, we are always seeking to hire exceptional talent to join some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to explore their passions to develop products that have real life impact. As well, Rambus benefits are among the most comprehensive and competitive in Silicon Valley.

Virtualization Administrator :
The Virtualization Administrator will be responsible for global virtualization and datacenter expert within the company and must work with existing system/storage administrators, technical leads, network support, application analysts/developers/architects, and other IT personnel to resolve day-to-day issues and to plan upgrades and other projects. Teamwork, ability to delegate work to less senior personnel, and being flexible to changes to the business are essential to be successful in this role. Datacenters and co-locations are currently located in Sunnyvale, San Francisco, Sacramento, Bangalore (India), North Carolina. Rambus is a growing high tech company with roots in memory design, and business areas in security. This position will be part of a dynamic organization IT organization supporting Legacy systems and implementing leading edge systems. The ideal candidate will provide direction to management on both tactical skills and strategic direction for the virtual environments
Responsibilities:
Manage and maintain virtualization infrastructure globally, including configuration, performance, capacity, monitoring, provisioning, life cycle, security, etc.
Support the virtual environment and monitoring
Support Dev/Ops environment (virtualization)
Partner with cross functional teams of IT and vendors to design and deploy virtualization infrastructure solution based on the project requirements
Manage and maintain VDI (primarily Citrix) environment
Support BU’s IT Business needs, For eg.. Benchmarking
Manage and execute on projects within the team and cross-functionally
Perform root cause analysis to resolve issues quickly in a complex IT environment
Ensure high availability and security by updating and patching systems
Evaluate, pilot, implement, integrate, and roll-out new solutions into existing data center environments
Support remote sites’ systems needs
Design systems to Business Continuity requirements, ensure run books and system documentation are up-to-date to for support and business continuity needs
Follow policies and procedures including those for ITIL incident, problem, change, and release management
Drive process improvements and make recommendations for continuous service improvement
Identify key risks on the technical design and work with involved teams to mitigate
Contribute to infrastructure technology strategies by staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices
Provide budgeting input and create purchase requests for projects, maintenance, capital, and expenses
Evaluate and manage vendors and contracts within budget
Train team, global service desk Level 2 members, and users as needed. Hand over repetitive/operational tasks to Level 2
Perform other duties as requested by team lead and manager
Support and manage virtualized cloud environment (AWS/Azure)
SKILLS:
Strong working knowledge of VMware ESX environment, Citrix VDI and HP/Cisco blade infrastructure
Strong working knowledge of Cloud services (AWS/Azure)
Strong working knowledge of security and system best practices
Strong working knowledge of storage and networking concepts
Ability and experience with building highly available, robust, manageable, and secure solutions
Strong knowledge of applications architecture components
Organized and being detail oriented with high initiative
Strong communication skills (written and presentations)
Must be able to work well with others
Strong project management and time management skills
Experience in a heterogeneous environment (including Linux)
Ability to work in a fast paced multi-tasking environment with flexibility and a positive attitude
Ability to travel to other locations (both domestic and international) as needed, sometimes on short notice.
Be able to respond to issues nights and weekends as needed, requiring carrying PDA 24/7
Qualifications:
BS or better in MIS, Computer Science, or related field required
5 or more years working with virtual enterprise infrastructure (VMware ESX, Virtual Center, SRM, Citrix, blades, storage, network/fiber channel switches, virtualization management tools, etc.)
VMware and Microsoft certifications are desirable
Rambus offers a competitive compensation package, which includes a strong base salary, bonus, equity, matching 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, comprehensive medical and dental benefits, time-off program and gym membership.

Rambus creates cutting-edge semiconductor and IP products, spanning memory and interfaces to security, smart sensors and lighting. Our chips, customizable IP cores, architecture licenses, tools, services, training and innovations improve the competitive advantage of our customers. We collaborate with the industry, partnering with leading ASIC and SoC designers, foundries, IP developers, EDA companies and validation labs. Our products are integrated into tens of billions of devices and systems, powering and securing diverse applications, including Big Data, Internet of Things (IoT), mobile, consumer and media platforms. At Rambus, we are makers of better. For more information about Rambus, visit rambus.com. For additional information on life at Rambus and our current openings, check out rambus.com/careers/.

Title: IT - Sr Systems Engineer
Description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.
The Developer/BSA will work closely with SharePoint sites Business Owners to gather customer requirements, conduct requirements analysis, and translate requirements into specifications. Coordinate and participate in gathering customer requirements. Analyze and assess design of business processes and their integration with technology, SharePoint Architects and other functional groups to design, develop, and engineer company's enterprise Microsoft SharePoint online (O365) system. The Developer/BSA will also work with members of the, Cross functional teams, Data Integration teams and other internal IT teams to balance the roadmap of SharePoint with other architectural roadmaps in Cadence IT. Overall, this role will be responsible for developing and delivering the solutions.

At Cadence, we use SharePoint online (O365) to support our global employees’ collaboration and workflow needs. We are committed to a mobile-friendly collaboration environment, so everything in our SharePoint environment is designed using Responsive Web Design and tested on a wide variety of mobile devices and desktop browsers. Our SharePoint environment is mission-critical, so we support it on a 24/7 Operational Basis. This role has overall accountability for ensuring our SharePoint environment meets Cadence’s present and future strategic needs.

Essential Duties and Job Functions:
Accountable to develop SharePoint sites in SharePoint online (O365)
Accountable to deliver SharePoint projects through effective collaboration with Project Managers, SharePoint Developers and Administrators, Business System Analysts and customers
Understand customer needs related to SharePoint and collaboration in general through development of strong relationships and compassion for business challenges
Author business cases for proposed IT projects related to SharePoint, and provide accurate project deliverables and resource estimates to the PMO
Work with business-retained SharePoint resources working directly on business-led initiatives. Integrate business-led initiatives into the IT SharePoint roadmap and project execution plans.
Contribute to the Cadence’s Collaboration Strategy, as related to SharePoint’s place in that strategy
In collaboration with the SharePoint and Enterprise Architects, create and maintain Cadence’s SharePoint technology roadmap, including utilization of third-party solutions and upgrade strategy
Ensure proper inspection readiness and compliance in all aspects of solution delivery and support
Lead continuous improvement efforts to improve Development quality, and business Processes.
Identify emerging SharePoint and application development software products, languages, and standards in support of development efforts
Provide Subject Matter Expertise on SharePoint online (O365) to IT teams and business users of SharePoint online (O365), offering advice and coaching on best practices
Develop and maintain standards and policies related to the Enterprise SharePoint environment. Document solutions and operating procedures and train personnel on executing in accordance with the procedures. Create Solution Design, System Configuration, etc. deliverables in collaboration with other teams.
Serve as the escalation point for any Priority 1 issues with the production SharePoint environment. During any outage, communicate effectively with IT leadership and the user community about the cause, duration and closure of the issue.
Assist with efficient implementation of new software products, tools or systems and for resolution of any adaptation issues.
Gather customer requirements, conduct requirements analysis, and translate requirements into specifications.
Translate and document end user requirements into specifications that can be leveraged to effectively design and develop SharePoint solutions.
Create business process flow charts to graphically depict customer business processes.
Look for opportunities to streamline, refine, and reduce redundancy within customer business processes via process re-engineering practices and principles.
Promote new collaborative capabilities available within SharePoint to help improve efficiency and increase productivity.
Contribute to internal business processes for SharePoint customizations and lifecycle management to include documentation, requirements gathering and analysis, testing, and development of best practices.
Conduct Knowledge Management (KM) activities to capture, share, and manage data, information, and organizational knowledge pertaining to the tactics, techniques, and procedures on how to effectively utilize IT assets that facilitate knowledge sharing.
Plan, develop, and maintain the Army Knowledge Management Plan to address information architecture, information management, and knowledge sharing.
Provide/collect input pertaining to the Command Records Management Program through coordination with the Management Support Division.
Review current practices for maintaining and archiving institutional knowledge and provide recommendations and business plan to improve current practices.
Understand Command taxonomy and coordinate with the customer to integrate and convert relevant folksonomy into the Command SharePoint Portal.
Research and conduct analysis of alternatives (AoA) for new and emergent technologies to incorporate where practical.
Suggest and institute/recommend innovative, continuous business and work process improvements to reduce cost, improve quality, and reduce cycle time.

Knowledge, Experience and Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or an equivalent of work related experience.
Must have a minimum of 3 years of SharePoint experience.
MUST have SharePoint online (O365) experience.
Proven track record delivering SharePoint projects on time, on budget and to the customer’s satisfaction. Able to give examples of projects that were delivered on tight timelines, with significant scope and multiple customer stakeholders.
Demonstrated relationship savvy in building effective trusted advisor relationships with business partners and IT alike using effective relationship-building, negotiation, mediation and influencing skills.
Ability to lead and manage under conditions of ambiguity and uncertainty.
Experience with Agile (or similar/related) methodology is a significant plus.
3+ years’ experience leveraging SharePoint in the analysis, design, development, implementation, and support of large, complex, enterprise-level solutions.
Self-motivated, Customer and Delivery focused. Ability to convey thoughts and ideas clearly and effectively in written and verbal form and have an aptitude for problem solving.
In-depth understanding of enterprise portals, collaboration tools, enterprise search, document and content management, and forms-based business process is required.
3+ years hands-on experience in using Web Parts, Site Collections, Content Deployment, InfoPath Forms, Excel Services, Business Data Catalogs, Site Columns, Content Types, Authorizations, Advanced Search, Master pages and Content pages, Search settings and workflows to accomplish business needs.
Knowledge of FAST search engine technology, and specific experience integrating with Line of Business (LoB) applications is a must.
Proven experience with optimization, troubleshooting principles, methodologies and issue resolution techniques.
Strong documentation creation and editing skills. Able to give examples of creating documentation and leveraging that documentation to improve facilitate architectural decisions.
Microsoft SharePoint certification is highly preferred, but not mandatory
We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Title: Sr Systems Support Engineer
Description:
Overview:

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

Responsibilities:
The primary purpose of this role is to :
Strong experience as a Windows System Administrator or Engineer with excellent hands-on experience with SCCM and system deployment.
Experience in the areas of OS deployment, patching, compliance, and reporting. Additionally, skills in WQL / SQL Queries to create SCCM reports, as well as profound knowledge on Microsoft Servers 2012 R2 through to 2019 are essential.
Scripting skills with PowerShell should be part of your top technical skills as well. Additional knowledge in web application technologies and security hardening will be very beneficial

Experience in supporting Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) Microsoft and third party patching, Workstation client, Operating System Deployment (OSD), and troubleshooting issues related to the infrastructure or functionality
Experience in designing, maintaining, and deploying SCCM based infrastructures
Update and execute continuity of operations (COOP) process, procedures and policies.

Ensure policies, processes, and procedures exist and when possible standardized and repeatable.
Analyze the security weaknesses and vulnerabilities of application software and recommending solutions as needed.
Monitor all identified systems and services utilizing approved tools.
Document procedures and processes used to research, assess, troubleshoot, test, and resolve support incidents.
Assist with maintenance of servers and network services.
Assist and coordinate with all support tiers as necessary to support project/task execution or with any escalated user requests or incidents.
Provide on-call and recall support as-required to sustain 24/7/365 operations.

Technical degree with a Computer Science Engineering/Information Technology Engineering
Experience:
5 to 7 Years of experience with SCCM, Windows patching, Server administration
Good to have / SCCM, Windows Server, Powershell, ITIL

Not Frequent

At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe.

Title: Hardware Networking
Description:
Functional Area Other
Industry Type Other
Keywords Desktop Administrator,Email,Workstation,Helpdesk,Tracking,Active Directory,Software,IT helpdesk,Service desk,Remote support,Hardware Networking
Job DescriptionComputer hardware engineers are responsible for the hardware configuration of a computer. They update systems by improving the components, layout and design of a computer for increased efficiency. They are expected to increase the speed and function of the computer. They also design the most compact and cost- effective model possible. Specifically, these professionals analyze existing systems to identify flaws or inefficiencies and use problem- solving skills, including both inductive and deductive reasoning, to make modifications that will increase the functions of the computer. Based on careful calculations and advanced knowledge of electronics, computer hardware engineers develop new designs in the existing components, such as microchips and circuit boards, and then integrate these components in a form fitting layout. These hardware engineers are responsible for the advances in computer systems. Computer hardware engineers are also responsible for related aspects of computer production. They are required to inspect modified computer systems ensuring that the product meets company standards. They also need to assess customer needs and offer clients technical support.

Title: Oracle Systems Administrator
Description:
Oracle Systems Administrator
When everything's connected, how we connect is everything.. . and we'd like to connect with you too! We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional customer experiences as a experienced
Oracle Sysadmin
to help with maintenance of global Oracle EBS instance.

At TTEC, we help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. We were founded on one guiding principle: customer experiences that are simple, inspired, and more human deliver lasting value for everyone. Your role brings that principle to life.

TTEC, a 50,000 employee, global customer experience pioneer, is opening a new information technology and data science center of excellence in Hyderabad where you'll have the opportunity to get in on the groundfloor of this expansion.

As a technologist, we know you're in high demand. And we know it's important you find the right fit for your future. Have ideas you want to contribute? We're listening. Looking for exposure to different clients, different technologies? It's what we do. Want to make an impact on the future? We're innovating every day. Teamwork key? You'll have the opportunity to work on global projects with a knowledge-thirsty, international team. Join our inclusive IT team and you'll help create meaningful employee experiences that drive memorable customer experiences.

What you'll be doing
Detail understand of Oracle menu, responsibilities , hierarchical structure
Good understanding of SOX and SOD ensuring compliance of the financial system
Ensuring financial compliance for all types of development in the system
Supporting day to day sysadmin tickets ( responsibility assignment, maintaining approval records for audit trail )
Configuration of concurrent requests and scheduling. Monitoring of jobs
Work directly with internal audit for all kind of audit needs
Patch analysis and work with DBA for any system related issues ( standard manager maintenance etc )
Following AIM / OUM methodology and documentation standard for development
Technical analysis of critical patch update, RUP patches

What you'll need to be successful
Bachelors / Masters degree in Systems or Computer Sc required
Minimum 3/4 years experience with Oracle EBS applications as sysadmin
Certification for any system compliance is a plus ( SOC1 SOC2 )
Knowledge in Oracle tech stack (PL/SQL, OAF, ADF, Workflows, BEML)
Working knowledge with most Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Projects, Visio, Outlook, SharePoint)
Outstanding customer service and communication skills
Exposure with Oracle GRC or similar tool preferred
Ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with peer groups

TTEC Values
Lead Everyday * Do the Right Thing * Reach for Amazing * Seek First to Understand * Act as One * Live life Passionately

Learn more about our business at TTEC.com or our culture at TTECjobs.com. #ExperienceTTEC

Primary Location
: India-Andhra Pradesh-Hyderabad

: Information Technology

Title: Desktop Support Engineer - L1
Description:
Req ID: 94963
NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.
We are currently seeking a Desktop Support Engineer - L1 to join our team in Navi Mumbai, Mahārāshtra (IN-MH), India (IN).
Below are the basic duties of engineers:
(a) Perform IT related service as instructed by NTT Service Delivery Manager or his/her del-egates.
(b) Addressing incidents faced by the users in their day-to-day use of IT
(c) Follow and enforce customer IT policy
(d) Provide support (including Installation, configuration and fine tuning support) for new Desktops / Laptops which shall include OS (Operating system) Installation, Power On Test, verification of Hardware Configuration, OS configuration, Configuring Mail Client, Con-figuring MS Office Applications (as per NTT Customer provided standards), Client side applications and Configuring Printers and resolving printing problems of the users at the in scope locations
(e) Supporting users by providing a timely and clear indication of the nature of the problem, the estimated time of completion and possible work-around
(f) Escalating unresolved problems as per the Escalation processes, through the Service Desk, keeping all relevant personnel in the communication loop.
(g) Diagnosing, verifying, recording and reporting downtime and providing immediate notifi-cation for all incidents
(h) Provide support for IMACDD (IMACDD - Installation, Move, Add, Change, Disposal, and Decommissioning) for End user Desktop/Laptop and Peripherals, Standalone and LAN attached PC & mid-range server. Coordinate the asset movement (IMACDD) across all locations.
(i) Emergency recovery maintenance for Desktops
(j) Installation and upgrade of any hardware component
(k) Disk formatting, partitioning and reinstallations of desktop OS/Applications
(l) Advise the End User to take reasonable steps to backup information, if possible, prior to attempting to effect a resolution either by hands-on during Desk Side Support Service; and provide reasonable assistance with file restoration, if required.
(m) Manage disk / folder sharing and permission setting on desktops.
(n) Provide support for patch up gradation on desktops.
(o) Providing field support for Desktop/Laptop & vendor coordination for peripherals
(p) Work on escalated issues from Service Desk based on physical support requirement
(q) Provide Diagnosis of Hardware or Software issues and work with OEM Vendor for getting them resolved
(r) Provide time to time proactive maintenance of peripherals for reduction of operational is-sues
(s) Educate users for common problems & their resolution
(t) Video Conference (VC) setup and troubleshooting
(u) Software Support (Standard Applications)
(v) LAN/Wi-Fi configuration and troubleshooting in end user’s system
(w) Backup – Need to facilitate the data migration from one machine to the other, in the process make sure the data is safe.
(x) Community Services – Systems after warranty period identified and donated for commu-nity services as a best practice of Customer. Those machines data will be completely wiped off and reconfigured to the old setup.
(y) Anti-Virus (AV) Support
(z) Provide support on installation and basic troubleshooting on client side application.
About NTT DATA Services
NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.
NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, disability, age, veteran-status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other class protected by law.

Rotary unites people from all continents and cultures who take action to deliver real, long-term solutions to pressing issues facing our communities. Title: IT System Administrator (MAC)
Description:
IT Systems Administrator (MAC)
Chennai
Founded in 2012, Socure is the leader in high-assurance digital identity verification technology. Named to Forbes' 2019 AI 50 list as one of America's most promising AI companies, and a recent winner of API World's Best Data API, Socure's technology applies artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques with trusted online/offline data intelligence from email, address, phone, IP, social media and the broader Internet to verify identities in real-time. Customers include three of the top five U.S. banks, seven of the top 10 U.S. card issuers, as well as the majority of leading digital banks, lenders and insurers across the U.S. We are funded by some of the world's best investors and entrepreneurs including Scale Venture Partners, Commerce Ventures, Work-Bench, Santander InnoVentures and Two Sigma Ventures.
The only way we can further our mission of becoming the single, trusted source of identity verification and eliminating identity fraud is by building the best team on the planet. This is where you come in!
Responsibilities:
Provide on-site support to our local Chennai users, as well as remote support to our remote users. We are a company of ~150, and we build a culture of automation into our products and practices. We seek to bring in an intrepid IT systems administrator who can hit the ground running and contribute positively to our growth, helping keep order in our IT department as our company grows.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Comp Sci/Engineering
3+ years of IT supporting Mac OSX (no Windows)
Hands-on experience with linux and/or UNIX-based operating systems
JAMF/Casper
Experience with Mobile device management (MDM)
Experience with networking, ideally VLAN administration

Title: System Administrator
Description:
About Blaize
Blaize is a ground-breaking deep technology company focused on making AI broadly accessible to enterprises and people. Our breakthrough silicon architecture and innovative software platform empower designers to more fully exploit the benefits of AI and lead the largest tech transformation in decades.
Position Overview
In the System Administrator role, you will be our front line in the most outwardly facing position within our IT organization. Your will be an enabler, a facilitator, and a supporter of a high performing and fast paced technology company, where a bias toward action and a sense of urgency are a part of every day.
Key Responsibilities:
Deliver an outstanding first-level end-user support experience.
Coordinate, diagnose and troubleshoot end-user support requests.
Provide support services to employees with technical problems and information technology issues involving desktop, laptop (Linux, Windows, and Mac), or network services from local personnel or from employees using VPN remote access.
Provide timely resolution of problems or escalation on behalf of customer to appropriate technical personnel.
Actively manage the incoming stream of requests/tickets to properly prioritize and route them. Provide ticket status updates to management and end-users.
Support and maintain effective relationships with users.
Develop, document, and implement standard operating procedures and customer service guidelines relating to IT support.
Evaluate new products, features and technologies which improve service availability and reduce costs, while providing comprehensive analysis and detailed implementation recommendations.
Automation - Drive simple and scalable approach to new technology solutions using automation to enable the organization to easily deploy and operate new features, capabilities, and functionality.
Typical Activities:
Computer Expert – Windows 10, Linux (Ubuntu) and Mac laptops and desktops, desktop hardware.
Application Expert – Windows 10, Linux and Mac Operating System support, desktop applications (Microsoft Office Suite), VPN client and specialized software as needed.
Planning – Change management, disaster readiness, capacity planning and designing future services.
What You Must Bring:
5+ years of solid experience supporting end users in an IT department.
Experience supporting an enterprise environment with Apple Mac devices.
Experience leading break/fix support and service provisioning activities.
Strong troubleshooting skills with ability to diagnose issues with hardware and software.
Ability to effectively maintain end-user device lifecycle management.
Experience performing installation and maintenance of end-user technology equipment including laptops, desktops, mobile devices, conference room technology, etc.
A bias toward action and sense of urgency
Driven to maintain a low active ticket count.
Strong follow up habits.
What You Should Bring
Strong customer-oriented communication skills. Able to communicate clearly in both speaking and writing.
Act as a trusted advisor to end-users on technology solutions.
Able to deliver impromptu training to users as needed on operation of technology.
Able to support system/network engineers as needed.
Embraces a continuous improvement culture where change is the norm.
Hands-on experience with ITIL highly desired.
Location:
Hyderabad, IN

Title: Windows Client System Engineer
Description:
Req. ID: 165261
Recruiter: Rohan Mallapragada
Ideal Candidate
The ideal ECI System Engineer has many years (6+) of supporting client and/or server hardware; troubleshooting basic hardware issues to parsing error messages/logs and designing a solution. They will have experience in building Windows OS images for different computer manufacturers and deploying them via Windows WDS/PXE. They are very knowledgeable in GPO and can properly deploy policies that are targeted to a specific audience as well as can analyze a system/user to troubleshoot a conflicting policy being applied. They will have some knowledge (2+ years) working with SCCM from an administrative perspective. They understand how a Distribution Point and Management Point work together when deploying software packages. They will have had experience in creating a collection and building and distributing a SCCM package. They will have had 2+ years working with small teams in multiple countries/across time zones and are comfortable working with different cultures. They’ve organized and completed small (< 10 hours) and large (>500 hours) projects independently within time and scope to the satisfaction of the customer. They are a self-motived, disciplined individual that thrives on engineering new solutions and enjoys success through the completion and implementation of said solution.

Required Skills - Technical
Create and manage Windows client operating system images (7/8.1/10)
Create and manage Windows server operating system images (2008 R2, 2012 R2)
Manage Windows Deployment Server (WDS) environment
Manage Active Directory (AD) objects
Administrate Group Policy Objects – create and maintain polices across multiple site AD environment (AGPM)
Experienced with System Center Configuration Manager (software packaging, creation of deployments, using collections, MPs and DPs)
Develop and maintain SCCM Task Sequences (OSD, MDT, WSUS)
Qualify new client and server builds (driver, OS and application installation)
Develop and maintain client side scripts (.vbs, .ps1, .bat)
Experienced in using client utilities/tools (wmi, psexec, regedit)
Can create and maintain SharePoint (2013) web pages
Develops Windows images with tools such as MDT, DISM or ImageX

Required Skills – Project Management
Able to accurately define, scope and complete projects independently and with small teams
Completes projects on time and with the resources allocated
Creates clear concise documentation
Can take technical concepts and issues in present them in an easy-to-understand manner
Keeps project members and customers informed of project status through various mediums

Experience/Other

Title: Sr. System Engineer
Description:
OPPORTUNITY FOR SR. SYSTEM ENGINEER
Greetings From iHR Outsoucing and Solutions Pvt Ltd !!!
JOB SUMMARY
The Systems Engineer of the IT Infrastructure team is responsible for managing the Production, Test, Dev infrastructure environments that run the solution to its clients across the region. It is essential that the person must have strong experience in Database Administration – for assisting Product Development and for managing Production instances, Windows Server administration and Networking. Must be a team player and is able to be flexible and stretch into other areas of responsibilities where needed.
DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Manage Production, Test, and Development environments running iHRos solutions that consists of Database, Windows Servers and other technical components hosted at the multiple state-of-the-art cloud infrastructure facilities and data centers.
Monitor production database instances and administer, maintain and troubleshoot issues including performance tuning and data archival.
Assist Product Development and Support Engineers in creating, refining, performing tuning SQL and PL/SQL queries.
Manage product releases and execute patch management.
Manage vendors related tasks
Provide end-user IT support as needed.
Other IT Infrastructure related tasks.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience in working as an Oracle Database Administrator
3+ years of experience in working with Windows Server and Networking environments
Experience with cloud services (ideally Azure, IBM).
Relevant industry certificates from Oracle and Microsoft will be preferred
Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology or equivalent.
Company Profile:
iHRos is a new kind of HR Solutions company that is embarking on a journey to reinvent the way HR Technology and Services are delivered by providing high value solutions that are client-focused, flexible, and easily integrated across the global HR value chain.
iHRos was founded through the acquisition of Buck Consultants' iHR™ software-as-a-service (SaaS) HR platform and Asia outsourcing operations. We have built upon that strong foundation and 25-year heritage with technology enhancements, highly skilled collaborative teams, and an end-to-end consultative approach that ensures we fully understand our client's business drivers, organizational goals, and HR service delivery environment to provide solutions that maximize return on investment.

Title: System Administrator
Description:
GotPrint, a rapidly-expanding online printing company, has an opening for a System Administrator. The System Administrator is responsible for effective monitoring and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. The qualified candidate will ensure that networking infrastructure; system hardware, operating systems, software systems, scheduled backups and related procedures are operational.
This individual is accountable for the following systems: Linux, Windows and network systems that support GotPrint infrastructure; Windows and Application systems that support Accounting and Order management. Responsibilities on these systems include SA engineering and provisioning, operations and support, maintenance and research and development to ensure continual innovation.
The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:
Install new / rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements.
4+ years of administrating Linux environments (Debian, RedHat, CentOS or Ubuntu)
2+ years of administrating Windows Active Directory and servers
3+ years of troubleshooting hardware and software bugs (know how to debug installation issues, missing drivers, bootloaders, etc.)
Robust TCP/IP networking knowledge including switching/routing (HP Procurve, Cisco, Checkpoint or Sonicwall)
Understanding of networking security concepts. (Being able to setup sandboxed/jail environments)
Experience working in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strategic and forward thinking
Ability to be proactive and work independently with limited direction
Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures.
Contribute to and maintain system standards.

About Us:
GotPrint has led the industry with its web-based Global operations and began building a nationwide network of offset printing facilities to provide faster, more responsive service to our customers. What began in Burbank, CA has now evolved across the United States with facilities in Kentucky and Texas and an international office in India.
Compensation/Benefits:
Medical benefits after 6 months probationary period
Provident Fund
Clean and safe work environment

To apply for this position, please email careersIN@gotprint.com with the job title in the subject of the email and your resume or CV attached.
