Title: Compliance Specialist (Contract)
Description:
The U.S. Pharmacopeial Convention (USP) is a scientific non-profit organization that sets standards for the identity, strength, quality, and purity of medicines, food ingredients, and dietary supplements manufactured, distributed and consumed worldwide. USP’s drug standards are enforceable in the United States by the Food and Drug Administration, and these standards are used in more than 140 countries.
USP promotes Diversity & Inclusion at Workplace and encourages Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action
Summary of the Position:
Functions as a compliance specialist responsible for reviewing and finalizing vendor,
3rd party and public health related due diligence. Provide support to global compliance
team on compliance and ethics related matters and other support areas identified, as
necessary.
Roles and Responsibilities:
1. Global Compliance & Ethics Support (75%)
 Interact with GCE, stakeholders in the organization to support the due diligence process,
including providing answers to questions, document collection and review.
 Prepare, finalize and put up for review due diligence reports for prospective Business Partners.
 Gather information from Stakeholders on prospective Business Partners and facilitate the due
diligence review.
 Recommend mitigation activities for red flags identified during the due diligence process.
 Finalize the due diligence recommendation or otherwise escalate and provide
recommendations to Global Compliance team.
 Monitor and respond to incoming emails and queries. Coordinate with key Stakeholders to
ensure post-approval follow up or monitoring steps;
 Archive due diligence review documents and approval forms;
 Any other compliance support identified from time to time by VP Quality & Compliance and
Director – Legal & Compliance;
2. Other areas of contribution; (25%)
 Assist Director Legal & Compliance with site related activities pertaining to maintaining the
e-Compliance system, mapping, reviewing and monitoring the system, act as a system
administrator;
 Manage, review, report and help stakeholders with compliances listed in the system;
 Keep abreast on local and central regulations impacting USP operations and ensure
compliance with these regulations are mapped and included in the e-Compliance system ;
 Assist site legal team with support pertaining to site compliance, legal, contractual or other
operational needs;
 Assist Director – Legal & Compliance with preparing, reviewing and maintaining Corporate
Secretarial records such as board minutes, general meeting documents, upkeep and maintain
legal records and registers;

Required Skills
A recognized Degree or Master’s Degree in Law; Or a Graduate in Commerce with
recognized compliance certification;

Required Experience
Graduate or any candidate interested in the role with 1-2 years experience

Title: Services Engineer I
Description:
A Service Engineer at Verimatrix thrives in a fast-paced environment solving support requests for our customers and partners. Service Engineer have a background in systems administration and/or network administration and a good understanding of how Verimatrix products fit within the larger ecosystem of integrated off-the-shelf and custom solutions. A successful Service Engineer will be proactive in preventing issues from arising and in notifying customers of possible issues. S/he is systematic their approach to problem-solving, curious and inquisitive as well as flexible. S/he will anticipate questions and issues customers and partners may have, and will share their feedback with Operations, Product Management, Engineering, Quality Assurance and Sales teams to improve product quality and increase customer satisfaction.
Main responsibilities:
Be part of the team of highly experienced services engineers that provides 24x7x365 support to customers.
Handle customer cases through portal/on-call and respond to cases in timely and professional manner to achieve high CSAT measured every quarter.
Contribute to knowledge base (KB) articles on regular basis and update the outdated articles (if any)
Participate during internal testing of new product release to validate fixed issues or new features.
Generate software licenses and delivering software to our customers
Updating our CRM system with up-to-date customer, system, project and case information
Install, configure and troubleshoot the company’s products
Main interfaces:
Global Operations team
Sales/Pre-Sales organization
Product Engineering teams
Required skills:
Experience in similar customer support roles.
Ticketing tools like Zendesk, JIRA, Salesforce.
Linux systems administration
AWS (EC2, RDS, Monitoring tools)
OTT(multiple DRM technologies)/DVB-S,C/MPEG&DVB tables/PSI(SI)
Static routes, DNS, Subnets/subnetting/etc.
Professional, positive, “can-do” attitude
Self-Motivated Learner
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills, and the ability to walk others through their logic
Required experience:
Total experience of 4 years in pay-tv/media/broadcast industry with:
At least 3-4 years of experience of working in large broadcast head-ends for DVB-C, DVB-S.
Around 2 years of hands-on experience in AWS.
Hands-on experience and knowledge in ABR/OTT/packaging/HLS or DASH manifests/etc.
Basic bash scripting and Linux server administration.
Educational background:
B.E./B.Tech. in CS/IT/ECE/EC from reputed college/university
BCA/MCA from reputed college/university
Bonus Qualifications:
AWS or AZURE certification
LPIC-1, LPIC-2, Oracle DB certification, Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), RED HAT OpenShift Administrator, Docker Certified Administrator (DCA);
SQL scripting, Oracle DB handling.
About Verimatrix
Verimatrix (Euronext Paris – VMX) is a global provider of security and analytics solutions that protect devices, services and applications across multiple markets. Many of the world’s largest service providers and leading innovators trust Verimatrix to protect systems that people depend on every day for mobile apps, entertainment, banking, healthcare, communications and transportation. Verimatrix offers easy-to-use software solutions, cloud services and silicon IP that provide unparalleled security and business intelligence. Proud to empower and protect its customers for more than two decades, Verimatrix serves IoT software developers, device makers, semiconductor manufacturers, service providers and content distributors. With 18 office locations in 12 countries supporting more than 1,200 customers, the company is uniquely positioned to secure and enable the connected future.

Title: Salesforce Administrator
Description:
We're looking for a
Salesforce Administrator(Mumbai, India)
This position offers an exciting opportunity in an internet software company with a smart workforce. Cornerstone is looking for a talented business analyst to drive a variety of new initiatives for our global client experience. The Salesforce Administrator will ensure that we are maximizing efficiency and capitalizing on the full features and benefits of the system based on business needs. We are seeking someone with excellent technical and communication skills who can interface directly with the customer facing team to understand their needs in order to administer and enhance the system accordingly. This person will promote adoption, keep current on new releases and AppExchange solutions, provide training, and more.
He/she must be a self-starter, who can take direction as well as provide direction when needed. Additionally, this role must also be a rockstar admin with proven Sales and Service Cloud experience within a global, multi-channel contact center.
In this role you will…
Team member for supporting Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Community, Knowledge, Live Agent, and CTI-related issues.
Work with leadership to create scalable solutions that support business strategy and growth
Serve as team member to support for Sales & Support teams to assist with questions on internal systems and workflows
Perform all the roles of the Salesforce CRM administrator including managing and maintaining databases, managing licenses, setting up profiles, installing company apps, create and maintain fields, views, reports, dashboards, campaigns and other salesforce.com objects and function
Document and maintain potential new solutions or enhancements to existing solutions, as well as document business processes, and functional requirements
Expand use of Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud and Community – attend planning meetings, assist with determining if /how salesforce.com can be used in new ways
Consideration for privacy and security obligations
You’ve got what it takes if you have…
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related experience and/or training
At least 2 years of working with Salesforce on various implementations.
Salesforce Advanced Admin and/or Developer Certification required
Salesforce implementation experience and extensive experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Lightning, Communities, Knowledge, Live Agent, and CTI
Experience in managing projects from conception to delivery
Extremely detailed oriented and process focused
Experience working on cross-functional, team projects
Experience with salesforce.com and force.com APEX development a major plus
A high proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Outlook Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Able to grasp complex system workflows and understand cause/effect for actions taken in such systems
Have outstanding written/oral communication skills, time management, and organizational skills
Our Culture:
Our mission is to empower people, businesses and communities. A culture created less by what we do and more by who we are. When people are asked to describe the team, the answer is always the same: Smart, Cool, Dependable, and Visionary. We are not a typical tech company (even with our unlimited vacation, paid sabbaticals, generous stock units, education reimbursement, because, well, our employees aren't your typical techies...)
We're always on the lookout for new, curious and capable people who can help us achieve our goal. So if you want to work for a friendly, global and innovative company, we'd love to meet you! What are you waiting for?
What We Do:
Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ: CSOD) was founded with a passion for empowering people through learning and a conviction that people should be your organization’s greatest competitive advantage. Cornerstone is a global human capital management (HCM) leader with a core belief that companies thrive when they help their employees to realize their potential. Putting this belief into practice, Cornerstone offers solutions to help companies strategically manage and continuously develop their talent throughout the entire employee lifecycle. Cornerstone’s HCM platform is successfully used by more than 75 million people in 180+ countries and in 40+ languages.
Check us out on Linkedin, The Muse, Glassdoor, and Facebook!
Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental commitment at Cornerstone OnDemand. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, color, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable Federal, State, or Local fair employment laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at careers@csod.com.

Title: Salesforce Admin
Description:
Salesforce Administrator
Summary
As the Salesforce Administrator, you will offer global Talent Management technology solutions aligned to the broader HR strategy to optimize HR effectiveness and efficiency.
We need your system administration experience, strategic thinking of the “big picture,” and ability to take ideas from vision to execution to help optimize our global HR organization! In this role, you will deliver HR technology solutions focused on talent management, support change management efforts internally and externally, and partner with a high performing team of professionals.
If you are great at building relationships in the organization, have stellar system administration skills, and can take a strong leadership role in implementing and maintaining Salesforce technology to support organizational objectives and business success, then you are the person we are looking for.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Function as the Salesforce platform subject matter expert to design and deliver an intuitive, positive, and scalable user experience.
Serve as the liaison to global functional teams to translate business needs into technical requirements; l ead technical aspects of project and solution delivery with a global mindset.
Participate in governance model for enhancement feasibility, prioritization, requirements, and change management.
Monitor usage and adoption of HR tools to identify training needs, system enhancements, and continuous process improvement activities.
Configure and support talent management requirements in the Salesforce platform
Develop and document administration procedures and system configurations
Partner with other teams including Learning & Talent Management and IT system administrators to successfully and efficiently maintain the global platform
Prepare all deliverables that are technology related
Partner with Solutions Leads to develop and execute training plans for subject matter experts and end users
Participate in Salesforce community to identify and share best practices and creative solutions to support business needs
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field and 3 – 5 years progressive experience in HR information systems; equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted.
Proven experience as a key technical resource leading the development of solutions in client environments
Willingness to flex schedule to accommodate working in various time zones across the globe.
Preferred Qualifications
Certification in Salesforce Administration
Proven ability to think strategically, work collaboratively, and balance multiple competing priorities.
Exceptional verbal and written communications skills including cross-cultural awareness, sensitivity in communication, and skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships.

Title: AWS SysOps Administrator
Company: Screen Magic Mobile Media Pvt. Ltd.
Description:
Company Overview
Screen Magic Mobile Media is Pune based software product company having Offices in USA & Delhi, India.
Screen Magic has around 120+ employees which consists Software Developers, QA, Sales Marketing & Customer Success.
SMS-Magic is the leading text messaging platform for businesses. For over a decade we’ve been helping companies better connect with their customers and because of our expertise, we are the most recommended text messaging application on the Salesforce AppExchange platform.
Our goal is simple: Deliver the most powerful text messaging for businesses, packaged in the simplest way possible for users of all types.
Over the years, we’ve worked with global customers across many industries including contact centers, financial services, higher education, retail, staffing, wellness and more. Our customers range from small and mid-size businesses to large enterprises.
Our commitment to each and every customer is this: We will continue to deliver the most advanced, simple-to-use messaging application available so that you can focus on delivering the personal touch that sets you apart from your competition.
Job Summary

The position requires a seasoned professional with a strong experience in architecting & configuration of Amazon AWS based cloud setup. It will be based out of Pune
Responsibilities and Duties
Manage the AWS infrastructure which includes setting up new EC2, S3, EBS, RDS, Redshift as per requirements
Manage the AWS costs - suggesting right EC2 images as per load, introduce AWS cost reduction practices.
Actively contribute to automate the build (ant/maven) and deployment process automation through CI/CD pipeline (Gitlab, Jenkins, SonarQube, Docker containers). Prior experience in developing and implementing DevOps Automation Solutions is must.
Manage Logging/Alerting stack which includes ELK, Datadog, Sensu etc to enable checks for proactive alerting of sites and api.
Conduct Monthly maintenance window and Keep systems updated with latest security updates.
Qualifications and Skills
Overall 5+ years’ experience as a Systems/Platform Engineer or (equivalent), 3+ years of prior experience as a DevOps Engineer for medium to large scale public cloud deployment (preferred AWS).
Extensive Knowledge & practical experience of Amazon AWS.
Well experienced in systems management esp. using ansible.
Comfortable in Bash/Python/Groovy or any scripting language.
Proficiency in deploying and maintaining Cloud-based infrastructure services (AWS, GCP, Azure - good hands-on experience in at least one of them).
Familiarity in designing and architecting secure applications in the public cloud.
Strong knowledge of common AWS services like RDS, Redshift, VPC, Cloudformation, Cloudwatch, ALB, S3, EC2 and IAM (User, Roles and Policies).
Good working knowledge and troubleshooting skills on Linux Operating System and web servers (Apache/Nginx).
Must be well aware of overall security aspects (mainly Infrastructure and Application stack) and encourage Dev teams for secure code practices.
Contribute effectively towards researching and implementing DevOps tools, deployment & monitoring tools fitting the product ecosystem to enable robust automation and seamless operations of the system.
Strong desire to explore, evaluate and understand new technologies

Certification :
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Application Support Engineer 4 - Salesforce
Description:
Connecting the world to wellness

MINDBODY emerged from the simple idea that small business owners deserve the time to focus on what matters most: their customers. Our software has transformed that vision into the world's leading wellness services marketplace, linking hundreds of thousands of passionate health, wellness and beauty professionals to the millions of clients they serve.

MINDBODY is a cloud-based business management software company for the wellness services industry.
We serve about 35 million consumers located in 130 countries & territories.
At MINDBODY, work-life balance takes on a new meaning for us. When your life goals & values align with the work you do every day, balance is second nature.

We help inspired business owners seamlessly succeed & individuals all over the globe lead healthier, happier lives with our technology.

Company Overview - https://company.mindbodyonline.com/
Follow our careers page here - https://mindbodyonline.com/careers
JOB SUMMARY –
MINDBODY’s IT Business Systems team is seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst IV. This is a full-time position in IT Business Systems, which partners with internal business teams such as Sales, Customer Service, Marketing, Human Resources, and Finance/Accounting.
You must possess expert knowledge of Salesforce.com, Sales, Finance, Customer Service, and Marketing processes and procedures as well as vast experience with SaaS platforms and customer relationship management.
You must possess a broad background in information technology, a practical understanding of how businesses work, as well excellent problem-solving, analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work towards becoming a Salesforce Certified Administrator (if not already).
Work towards becoming a Gainsight Certified Administrator (if not already).
Participate in the Change Management process.
Maintain and update users, roles and profiles, passwords, security settings, sharing rules, etc.
Configure various applications to meet business requirements.
Create custom report types, reports, and dashboards.
Participate in user requirement sessions and document user requirements to address changing business needs.
Collaborate with the BSA2, BSA3, Team Lead, and BS Manager to assist in implementing any new tools, processes, etc.
Create Test Scripts for new features or functionality.
Thoroughly test new features and functionality developed by other BSA team members.
Perform mass updates to data using various tools.
Should be self-driven, good communicator and a team player.
Partner with the various departments to define and document process, strive for operational excellence and translate business problems to solutions.
Develop and provide training to a variety of user audiences that have a variety of technical skill levels.
Manage multiple small to medium-scope projects, including requirements gathering, developing work breakdowns and project plans, track task status, and escalate as needed to keep projects on schedule.
Define and document processes, capture functional requirements and create process flows.
You are able to quickly learn new technologies, find creative solutions to a wide variety of problems, and communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s Degree required. MIS or related field preferred.
7+ years’ experience with Salesforce.com administration, including advanced customization and configuration, familiarity with Apex, and process documentation.
Salesforce.com Admin Certification required.
Salesforce.com Advanced Admin Certification or Developer Certification required.
Experience with “The Big Four” accounting/auditing firms a must.
Experience with SOX, HIPAA, PCI, GPDR, CCPA compliance requirements a must.
Strong understanding of business units (Sales, Customer Service, etc.) and their processes.
Excellent oral and written communication/documentation skills.
Excellent understanding of IT business processes.
Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Community Cloud, CPQ, Heroku, Mulesoft experience is highly desirable.
Excellent understanding of current integrations a plus: Netsuite, Aria, Zuora, Marketo, DocuSign, Gainsight, SpringCM, NC Squared, Outreach, TextUs, ZoomInfo, FinancialForce, etc.
Proven track record in driving results; ability to coordinate and prioritize concurrent activities within deadline-driven climate.
Lightning implementation and administration experience preferred.
Familiarity with custom API integrations & troubleshooting.
Ability to work independently and in collaborative teams.
Shows tenacity in resolving technical problems and attaining business objectives.
Experience integrating tech stacks due to M&A activity.

SCOPE OF SUPERVISION/AUTHORITY:
Duties for this position are performed under limited supervision
You will be responsible for planning and organizing their own work, which may or may not be directly related to general business operations of the company or its customers
You will receive training and guidance from manager as needed
Individual contributors may be required to regularly exercise discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance depending on the nature of the position
There is no direct management responsibility for the position

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
You will need dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard
This position is mostly stationary and will be required to remain stationary for extended periods of time
Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderately quiet

Title: Information Technology Manager - I
Description:
Position:
Information Technology Manager - I
Job Description:
Information Technology Manager I
IT Manager is defined as a position within the IT Infrastructure support of the organization, which is responsible for the daily support and maintenance of Arrow’s remote Datacenter infrastructure. As well, IT Manager is responsible for managing and administering a team of professionals working on all forms of UNIXs (RH and AIX),Cloud, Windows, Citrix and Storage Systems.
What You’ll Be Doing
Analyze and troubleshoot problems involving all the mentioned technologies and support production environments.
Responsible for supporting more than 5000 virtual and physical servers and more than 15 PB of data.
Responsible for rolling out new Production/Qual and Dev environments including pre and post jobs
Responsible for supporting Arrow’s various cloud and virtualization technologies like the Azure, VMware, IBM LPAR , VIO , Hypervisors, Citrix across multiple Datacenters in the US
Hands on experience on Server Platforms such as IBM and HP Servers and use of ILO, onboard administrator and HMC consoles
Responsible for managing backups and storage on virtualization and server side storage support.
Responsible for supporting Arrow’s critical ERP servers and ERP applications across all regions
Responsible for Hardening of the OS and environments
Responsible for managing Enterprise Backup environment
Hands on experience on Storage requirements for internal cloud and virtualized Platforms
Responsibilities include Migrations and Integration of existing and new environments
Provide support, working directly with the Applications Developers, users and Helpdesk.
Attend critical bridge calls and Engineering calls and escalation.
Interface with other groups within the organization during all phases of projects, from design through inception
Participate in the EPR go-live programs and war rooms
Implement scripting for automation and automate the Global data center activities with Chef, Satellite and Ansible etc
Support Arrow’s Disaster Activity exercise and support the DR side of the IT infrastructure including the VMware environment and the SRDF support.
Leading the monitoring efforts of daily system processes/tasks/utilization
What We Are Looking For
A Minimum of 14 years of hands-on experience in Red hat Linux, VMWare and IBM AIX . LPARs, Windows, Citrix and Middleware platforms in production environment (administration, configuration and troubleshooting)
Sound knowledge of Cloud computing and Azure
Sound knowledge of SAN and NAS
Ability to analyze performance issues and provide root cause using analysis logs and various tools.
Ability to analyze the capacity and performance requirements
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with client and team relationship/interaction skills
Experience in a large corporate environment would be an added advantage
About Arrow
Arrow Electronics, Inc. (NYSE: ARW), an award-winning Fortune 109 and one of Fortune Magazine’s Most Admired Companies. Arrow guides innovation forward for over 175,000 leading technology manufacturers and service providers. With 2019 sales of USD $29 billion, Arrow develops technology solutions that improve business and daily life. Our broad portfolio that spans the entire technology landscape helps customers create, make and manage forward-thinking products that make the benefits of technology accessible to as many people as possible. Learn more at www.arrow.com.
Our strategic direction of guiding innovation forward is expressed as Five Years Out, a way of thinking about the tangible future to bridge the gap between what's possible and the practical technologies to make it happen. Learn more at https://www.fiveyearsout.com/.
For more job opportunities, please visit https://careers.arrow.com/us/en.

Description:
He/She would be responsible for installation, implementation, sizing of the clusters and maintain ongoing Hadoop Infrastructure as part of our global managed services for our client.
Role

He/She would be responsible for installation, implementation, sizing of the clusters and maintain ongoing Hadoop Infrastructure as part of our global managed services for our client.
He/She would be responsible for ensuring high availability of the services in the cluster and ensuring that the resources are properly utilized and monitored.
He/She should be well-versed with opensource as well as proprietary monitoring tools in terms of installation, tweaking it for onsite client setup and requirement of the specific Hadoop and Hadoop ecosystem components.
He/She should available for on-call as well as overlapping hours with other on-site teams and ensure proper updates in ticketing system of handovers for any incidents as well as day to day activities.

REQUIRE

Graduate in any discipline preferably in IT/ Computer Science degree would be additional plus.
Around 5/6+ years of experience with relevant technologies like Hadoop – Apache Hadoop 2.7.1, Hortonworks HDP 2.4.2, Ambari 2.2.2, HDFS, MapR 5.x, MapReduce,Hive 1.2.1 , Tez 0.7 , Pig 0.15, HBase 1.1, Phoenix for HBase , Sqoop 1.4.6, Zookeeper 3.4.6, Spark 1.6, Ranger 0.5 , Knox 0.6, Shell Scripting, ElasticSearch 1.6.2,Tableau 9, Zeppelin 0.6, Cloudera CDH 5.10.0.
Installing/managing Unix/Linux systems, and various application server like Hadoop.

Detailed experience building a secured infrastructure with awareness of security best practices.
Experience in setting up services like YARN, HDFS, Zookeeper, HIVE, IMPALA, HBASE and APACHE PHOENIX etc.
Experience in setting up security for Hadoop Clusters using Kerberos, LDAP, Active Directory.
Experience in setting up Sentry, Apache Ranger for access control.
Experience with SOLR, REDIS, MEMCACHE, RABBITMQ, BIND, POSTFIX is a plus.
Experience in scripting is must and additional knowledge on configuration management tools like CHEF, PUPPET and ANSIBLE is a plus.
Experience in installing, maintaining and setting replication of MySql DB.
Experience to fine tune and customize applications, databases, webserver (nginx,apache,mysql) server, perform troubleshooting and tuning.
Good knowledge of TCP/IP protocol (routing, firewalling, networking)
Detailed hands on experience with networking devices.
Experience in managing various version control system (preferably git)
Some experience with load-testing tools. basic understanding of load testing techniques.
Strong analytical, prioritizing, planning, problem-solving, and presentation skills.
Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to lead and manage team.
Ability to design the structure, plan the capacity, performance fine-tuning
Ability to work with and influence team and senior management
Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting

Description:

The organization's Messaging infrastructure is utilized across the globe by more than 60.000 users as part of the Microsoft Office 365 The Messaging and Communications Team is responsible for planning, designing, installing, configuring, monitoring, maintaining, supporting and optimizing the Merck's Office 365 Messaging Hybrid architecture.
The Team performs hands-on tasks to manage and maintain Merck’s Messaging system (Online and Hybrid infrastructure) and related technologies.
The team works together with other infrastructure units like Network-, IAM- and Security teams, provides input and collaborates with the Global Service Desk and structures services based on requirements from application and business units. Effective communications and accountability are of the highest importance.
Your Responsibilities:
Manage and monitor Skype hybrid infrastructure and connected systems towards skype/MS teams online (i.e. ADFS, Azure AD, etc.).
Providing functional and L2 technical support for resolution of customer problems, incidents, issues, requests and queries pertaining to mainly Skype issue and related systems.
Document changes to the systems using change management best practices.
Maintain a highly secure system through proper configuration and system access monitoring.
Assist with the migration of large volumes of data into the cloud platform.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with user related to Instant messaging topics.
Maintain a good understanding of upcoming changes to the platforms to assist with user change management.
Deliver a consistent process for incident and problem escalation along with resolution in line with the sourcing governance framework.
Collaborate with other IT staff, including networking, security, and data center operation teams, to facilitate effective issue resolution.
Think globally and works together across departments and geographies, encouraging teamwork that respects diverse backgrounds and cultural differences to drive results.
Who You are:
Professional experience in IT in a large Enterprise environment with many thousands of users.
Willingness to join a team supporting the service in a 24 h / 7d operation model.
Operate, monitoring, maintain and troubleshoot of Instant Messaging technologies such as Skype and MS Teams.
Experienced and well versed in all Microsoft environments like Skype (on premise/online), Azure\On-Prem AD administration, Windows Server and Exchange Server Administration.
Understanding and troubleshooting support on firewall, Gateway and security technologies.
Support processes with interfacing Service Desk, Field Service and 3rd level support
Mature and self-motivated professional able to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.
Experience in supporting users globally.
Responsibility for the improvement of all products, services, processes and working routines within the working area.
Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to facilitate communication and coordination with network users throughout the company
ITIL processes like Incident-, Problem-, Change- and Service Continuity management.
Specific knowledge and competencies required:
6+ years of Skype On-Premise and Skype/MS Teams Online experience in Large Enterprise Environment.
Deep knowledge of Microsoft Skype and MS Teams.
Ability to create PowerShell scripts to schedule repeatable Office 365 actions and to manage Skype/Teams Online and On-Prem.
Understanding of supporting Office desktop messaging related applications.
Thorough working knowledge and ability to troubleshoot all networking. related issues (DNS, Routing, Network Protocols, etc.).
Knowledge of SMTP routing, LDAP, DNS, Mail Routing, and SMTP Troubleshooting, messaging is an add on advantage
Administration and Troubleshooting of Mail Relay is an add on advantage
Knowledge about Reverse Proxy Solutions
Knowledge about Server Platform technology
Understanding and working Exchange mailboxes, distribution lists Groups and contacts will be an add on advantage
Excellent customer service and telephone skills, and experience in a professional service environment, with responsibility for supporting multiple applications and network environments.

MCSE or MCITP (Microsoft Certified IT Professional)
MCSA (Microsoft Certified Solution Associate) working towards MCSE.

Title: Middleware Administrator
Description:
Introduction
We build phenomenal products that our customers rely on so it’s important they are running at their best. As a Systems Management Specialist, you will work with the latest software to keep moving business forward. Whether it’s our Engineering teams that need a test environment or our software running in production, we are seeking skilled systems management professionals ready for the challenge.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM's Purpose is to be essential to our clients, to the world and one another and we are confident that together as IBMers we will drive this purpose. When you join IBM you join a culture of openness, teamwork, trust, and the invitation and expectation to have a voice. Join us and Do your Best Work Ever.
We are recognized gold standard for inclusion, reflected in winning, to name a few, the 2018 Catalyst Award for advancing women in business, the National Award 'Best Employer of People with Disabilities' and being named one of the top 5 2018 Top Companies for Women Technologists for building an inclusive work environment — We advocate for fairness and equality as everyone is, and always has been, welcome at IBM.
Join a brand with a history of continuous re-invention, transforming itself throughout its 100-plus years. In the past five decades alone, IBM has ushered in the eras of the mainframe, the personal computer, IT services and enterprise software. In its current transformation, IBM is once again leading the reordering of the technology industry.
Business Unit Introduction
Our IBM Global Technology Services (GTS) helps clients plan, implement and lead an efficient, resilient, flexible IT infrastructure. Be it ground-breaking outsourcing tied to business outcomes or integrated managed services or discrete services - IBM GTS is the partner of choice for infrastructure services.
Come join our team of IBM experts, who are leaders with vision, distinguished engineers and IT architects who have worked with thousands of clients to transform enterprise IT, migrate to cloud, apply automation and ensure business continuity. We help client run their IT better, accelerate innovation and deliver unmatched performance with the power automation.

Level 2 Support, Installation, Configuration, Maintenance & Troubleshooting of JBoss & IIS as a primary skills.

Title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
Description:
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
Your Career
As a Salesforce Administrator, you will interface directly with business users to understand business requirements, define solution architecture, create technical specs, design, develop and implement solutions focused on the Salesforce platform.
We are looking for a rock star to work on one of the larger and more complex Salesforce implementations with lots of opportunities to learn new aspects of Salesforce, gain valuable experience, and make a huge impact in a fast-growing company.
You will apply an open communication and collaborative style and lead by example, being both customer-centric and service-minded, able to interact with end-users, executives, analysts, and technical colleagues – creating consensus and clear strategy where appropriate.

Your Impact
Deliver scalable, high-quality Salesforce services in support of our company mission
Provide excellent customer service to Salesforce users
Administer Salesforce
Triage and fulfill incoming service requests
Assist developers with reporting, configuration and data migration
Support release planning and deployment
Maintain system KPIs to track trends in usage and data integrity
Help team ensure compliance with IT policies and procedures
Keep up with current technology trends
Assess and make recommendations on processes, designs, operations, and testing
Deliver special projects as needed in an effective and efficient manner
Your Experience
Salesforce Administrator certification
Superior Salesforce administration skills
Basic knowledge of MS Excel
Basic knowledge of Data Loader
Ability to work with people in every part of the company
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Ability to pick up new skills quickly
Preference for working in teams
Willingness to take direction
Ability to take initiative as needed
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management
Understanding of testing and release processes
Track record of creativity and innovation
Good sense of humor
Nice to have: Salesforce Certifications, Knowledge of Salesforce best practices, Experience with Force.com Migration Tool (Ant), Experience with Force.com IDE (Eclipse), Experience with Apex/Visualforce, Experience with CPQ, Experience with Service Now
The Team
Working at a high-tech cybersecurity company within Information Technology is a once in a lifetime opportunity. You’ll be joined with the brightest minds in technology, creating, building, and supporting tools and that enable our global teams on the front line of defense against cyberattacks.
We’re joined by one mission – but driven by the impact of that mission and what it means to protect our way of life in the digital age. Join a dynamic and fast-paced team that feels excitement at the prospect of a challenge and feels a thrill at resolving technical gaps that inhibit productivity.
Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

Title: IT Engineer / Linux Administrator
Description:
Job Information
Work Experience
1-2 years
Job Description
We are looking for a Linux administrator who will be responsible for designing, implementing, and monitoring the infrastructure; also, to collaborate with other team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes. You will become an integral part of the team, making every problem of the platform a problem of your own, and solving them accordingly.


Requirements
Desired Skills & Experience

Previous working experience as a Linux Administrator for minimum 1 year
IN depth knowledge of Linux: RedHat, CentOS, Debian, etc.
Solid knowledge in FTP, SSH, DNS, SSL, HTTP, HTTPS, LDAP, SMTP, Caching etc
Familiarity with the fundamentals of Linux scripting languages
Experience installing, configuring, and maintaining services such as Nginx, Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, Postgres, PHP, Python, NodeJS etc.
Familiarity with load balancing, firewalls, etc.
Proficient with network tools such as iptables, Linux IPVS, HAProxy, etc.
Experience with virtualization technologies.
Ability to build and monitor services on production servers
Experience in handling hardware installation and maintenance (server, firewalls, switches etc..)
Experience on the hardware elements and understanding on all hardware infrastructure includes, workstations / servers / firewalls / switches / etc.
Excellent Knowledge in Web Hosting Control Panels like Cpanel, Plesk, Direct Admin etc
Knowledge in managing server with Terminal / SSH / Cloud interfaces.

Added Advantages


Certifications like CCNA, MCSE are a plus.
Familiarity with Continuous Integration Tools such as Jenkins etc.
Exposure to Load balancer technology would be a plus.
Experience in configuration management tools, such as Puppet, Ansible etc.
Experience in scripting languages such as Python or Bash
Knowledge of integrated maintenance tools

Responsibilities

Installation, configuration and administration of various Linux/Unix platforms.
Troubleshooting problems pertaining to system performance, network administration.
Performing all configuration changes to software and patching, firmware upgrades.
Maintain best practices on managing systems and services across all environments.
Consult with customers to deploy best practices in their development, QA, DevOps and operations teams
Deploy Dev/QA/Stage/Prod environments and configuration.
Collaborate with other teams and team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes.
Provide input on ways to improve the stability, security, efficiency, and scalability of the environment.
Managing servers through Terminal / SSH / Cloud interfaces / CPanels / Plusk.
Preparing RCA (Root Cause Analysis) for High Severity issues.
Proactively monitoring system performance and capacity planning.
Proactively maintain and develop all Linux infrastructure technology to maintain a 24x7x365 uptime service
Manage, coordinate, and implement software upgrades, patches, hot fixes on servers, workstations, and network hardware and ensure that all systems are operating correctly.
Manage hardware issues and find solutions for the team & infrastructure.
Maintain and ensure minimum downtime of VPN, VoIP and Internet access.
Hardware Inventory - Manually track & update the hardware movement in asset register with immediate effect.
Daily Monitoring - Check Server events, Email Server alert and physical health, take necessary action if any hardware failure / abnormal observed.

Title: Sr. Associate - Projects
Description:
Technical Lead
Qualification:
Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent
Responsibility:
Project Planning and Setup:
Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review.
Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc.
Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project.
Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements.
Requirement Understanding and Analysis:
Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements.
Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.
Design:
Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead.
Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable.
Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review.
Suggest changes in design on technical grounds.
Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements.
Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer).
Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.
Coding:
Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality.
Share developed code with supervisor for review.
Rework on the code based on inputs if required.
Perform complex integration.
Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.
Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.
Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.
Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.
Conduct technical troubleshooting.
Conduct reviews for codes created by team.
Testing Management:
Develop unit test case for each module.
Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects.
Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment.
Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing.
Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.
Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.
Raise issues to leads/QA.
Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.
Share revised code with supervisor for review.
Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.
Configuration Management:
Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers.
Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.
Deployment:
Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan.
Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in.
Maintain deployment tracker.
Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production.
Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.
Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities):
Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them.
Provide guidance through SDLC.
Provide status of progress to leads.
In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.
Service Support and Maintenance:
Specific to production and maintenance support:
Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team.
Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident.
If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process.
Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.
Knowledge Management:
Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't.
Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository.
Guide developers in creating such documents.
Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).
People Management:
Conduct training through academy or internally within the team.
Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring.
Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead.
Must Have Skills
Qlikview

Title: Senior Zabbix Administrator – Cloud Infrastructure
Description:
Position: Senior Zabbix Administrator – Cloud Infrastructure
Experience: 6-10 Years

Role:
As Senior Zabbix Administrator of Infrastructure & Cloud Operations monitoring, you will lead a team of sysadmins in the design, implementation and maintenance of a Global Enterprise monitoring system. As part of the overall Cloud Infrastructure Monitoring Platform Practice, the Senior Admin will be responsible for developing & managing a high-performance team, dedicated to building, developing and maintaining a world-class monitoring solution. To achieve this, you would develop the AWS/Oracle Public cloud, Private Cloud delivery teams, foster alignment with internal stakeholders and drive operational excellence, whilst supporting best-in-class customer engagement and enabling the expansion of the Cloud customer base.

Technical Expectation:
10+ years' experience in overall Enterprise monitoring (Zabbix a requirement), while 5+ years’ experience in engineering design for a global enterprise deployment
Strong knowledge and experience with AWS and AWS based networking (VPC, Route 53, Tunneling, etc.).
Understand Incidents, SR, Problem, Change from Cloud Ops perspective
Excellent organizational, project management, interpersonal and written/oral communication skills Ability to communicate technical prop
DETAIL Oriented
Automate select network administration tasks through creation and maintenance of scripts and tools
Strong understanding of architecture of various Monitoring Tools (Solution designing, Planning, Implementation, Configuration, Integration, Troubleshooting and administration)
Engineering-level understanding of Zabbix. (Evaluates software requirements and capabilities and makes recommendations)
Ability to write function / script (items) in Zabbix to enable monitors of all technology endpoints like VMWare, Oracle, Cisco, Palo Alto etc.
Ability to configure alerts in Zabbix servers (understand and assess the business use and downstream use of the configurations / customizations made to the Monitoring Tool)
Demonstrates proficiency in monitoring and management communications, technologies including but not limited to WMI, SNMP, SysLog .
Installation, maintenance, removal and reinstallation of monitoring tools (Ability to install and configure Zabbix server, Zabbix proxy server and Zabbix endpoints)
Removal of monitoring tool, as well as removal of connectivity of the customer environment.
Retesting of accounts and connectivity to the servers when new connectivity methods are established.
Test connectivity to the accounts and new servers. Meetings with the client to review this process
Handle updates/changes to Threshold changes, including of database update.
Adding instances to currently monitored servers
Migration of servers
Backup and restore partial or complete monitoring database
Ability to identify, troubleshoot regular issues. Also troubleshooting regular/complex Zabbix server functionality in case of errors.
Troubleshooting network connectivity for monitored servers or support servers with IP changes including changes to the currently configured monitoring which involves troubleshooting items such as SNMP, WMI, agents failing to connect, etc.
Able to troubleshoot and research issues, using outside resources such as technical forums and knowledge bases that are available through the Internet.
Review of all servers, instances, and thresholds for an entire client.
Scripting and testing PowerShell/ Linuxscripts for new/custom monitoring checks, or appropriating older checks for current use to mirror functionality of older tools to a reasonable degree.
Required Skills:
Hands on experience on Monitoring tools (Zabbix in required skills, other like Nagios/ SolarWind /Etc. can be added advantage).
Determine technical requirements to carry out various monitoring activities.
Solution designing, Planning, Implementation, Configuration, Integration, Troubleshooting and administration for the Monitoring Tools
For migration efforts, ensure assigned engagement team are kept informed about migration status, installation progress, barriers, and move quickly to ensure customer monitoring is enacted as soon as possible.
Prepares and maintains documentation of system configurations and customizations.
Basic understanding of ITSM practices
Provides guidance to internal departments.
Available for 24x7 coverage.
Self-motivated individual, able to work independently or on a team.
Able to multi-task and work productively in a dynamic environment.
Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures.

Title: Server Administrator (M)
Sr. Linux Administrator – L3
Description:
::Job Description::
Linux administrator with experience managing servers in a Datacenter. Support servers running Apache, JBoss, Tomcat, MySQL replication/clusters, Load balancing, virtualization, Cloud infrastructure.
Work as part of a global Service Desk team to deliver responsive resolutions, communications, and
support services, based on ITSM best practices, to customers and service teams and ultimately drive and
improve service on behalf of the business. It will be a challenging environment where you will be
required to work on multiple technologies in IT Infrastructure.
::Key Responsibilities::
1. Respond to phone and online help desk requests from clients, provide resolutions in a timely and capable fashion.
2. Provide answers to clients by identifying problems, researching answers and guiding clients through corrective steps.
3. Utilize your technical troubleshooting skills to provide hands-on support at the server and infrastructure level.
4. Maintain internally and client infrastructure by providing system support, identifying system improvements, upgrading, installing, and configuring systems.

Internet of Things, Serverless Computing, WorkFlow Management, Mobile Development and Game Development. For us at AWS, that means IoT, Alexa, Lex, Lambda, Mobile Hub, DeviceFarm, Notification services, StepFunctions, Greengrass, Deepracer and Lumberyard . These are some of the services that we help our customers use to their maximum potential as they build the next wave of applications.
IN this role, you will be at the forefront of Cloud technologies, interacting and mastering the full breadth of AWS services. You will be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about niche technologies in Cloud Computing and believe that world class support is critical to customer success and innovation.
You will provide L2 and L3 technical support and advice to a wide range of global enterprise customers as they build mission critical applications with the full suite of AWS services. The team is globally distributed, working under a follow-the-sun model and is growing rapidly.
Our support engineers are responsible for helping customers utilize all services offered within AWS. They also act as the “voice of the customer” to the development teams for recurring issues or feature requests.

Amazon’s technology business has a history and tradition of leading the world in web related technologies and services. Being a member of Amazon Web Services (AWS) you have the chance to help individuals and businesses take their computing infrastructure, applications and ideas into the Cloud.

Every single day will bring new and exciting challenges and huge amount of learnings on the job while you:
§ Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our global enterprise customers' dynamic needs
§ Work directly with Amazon Web Services Architects to help reproduce and resolve customer issues
§ Use your experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our AWS services
§ Support engineers not only work a broad spectrum of technical issues but also coach/mentor new hires, develop and present training, partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives, participate in recruiting, write tools/script to help the team, or work with leadership on process improvements

§ Exposure to security concepts / methodologies

§ Experience handling full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications
§ Experience working with identity providers (i.e. Login with Amazon, Facebook Connect, OpenID, etc.) / OAuth
§ Experience with push notifications, APNS and GCM

Title: Openstack Administrator
Description:

Location: Chennai
Experience: 6 to 10 Years
Notice Period: Immediate

Title: Solution Delivery Expert - JIRA
Description:
Contribute to or support aspects of planning, design, development and delivery of system solutions for a specific business or technology area, in alignment with design and architectural standards and business requirements. Bring together, qualify and help prioritize new IT demand and ensure IT services provided to business are meeting service quality standards as per agreed SLAs.
Represent IT to the business or IT groups receiving services, ensuring that expectations for IT services are met. Identify and qualify new demand with overall responsibility for steering proposals through the early phases of approval; participate in establishment of budgets and investment proposals and obtain sponsorship and funding. Ensure the introduction of new / modified services happens in a planned, controlled and timely manner to minimize disruption and maximize benefit. Create the detailed IT solution/service design, based on functional specifications, to meet quality and performance requirements and technical constraints. Develop, build, configure, customize and unit test solutions based on the functional and technical specifications to meet quality and performance requirements. Hold end to end accountability for business processes, integrate services horizontally across organizational units, and manage interfaces between Service Delivery projects. Manage the planning, design and build of Agile Tool Solutions (Jira and Confluence), based on specifications, while meeting quality and performance requirements and technical constraints. Manage the scheduling, deployment and improvement of Agile Tool Solutions (Jira, Confluence) solutions across multiple functions. Assess business requirements and translate requirements into Agile tool solutions in Jira, Confluence, software addons.
Develop project rationale and perform scoping assessments to determine functional and technical feasibility of projects and enhancements
Design, build, test solutions to ensure they meet configuration, security, data and quality standards and organize training and deployment
Ensure that developed solutions are peer reviewed, formally documented and signed off by business
Ensure that detailed designs match high level designs and are traceable to requirements in functional specification
Ensure adherence with Security and Compliance policies and procedures
Establish standardized design and development processes to enable cost effective delivery
Ensure solutions produced adhere to architectural roadmap of Jira and Confluence and support operations of solutions
Ensure the overall user experience is taken into account when designing and deploying new solutions and services
Ensure that all work is delivered to agreed time, cost and quality constraints.

Minimum requirements
Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Engineering Discipline or equivalent Language: English very well spoken and written
8+ years of experience in implementation and operation of Jira and Confluence software solutions in regulated IT environments (pharmaceutical industry).
Senior, hands-on expert knowledge in system configuration (e.g. workflows, permission, screens, spaces) of Jira and Confluence software, deployed on Jira data center platform
At minimum 2 successfully completed Jira and Confluence implementation projects in an analyst and site administrator role.
Expert knowledge in compliance related activities within IT Projects and Operations (e.g. GxP, CSV, SOX, ITIL, SixSigma) in regulated industry
Excellent analytical and conceptual thinking, proactive problem solving, open to new learnings
Strong ability to interact and operate in an international environment, across various functions and levels
Excellent communication and team collaboration

Why consider Novartis?

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Title: Senior Cloud Application administrator
Description:
Employee Type:

Together we are powering the future of Higher Education
Here at Ellucian, we are motivated by a mission. Higher education is facing a profound change what with the shifting demographics and cultural perceptions, combined with declining support and rising expectations. This is forcing colleges and universities to do more with less and that is where we come in.
As true believers in the power of education to transform lives, we are dedicated to helping all of our customers thrive—not just survive—by transforming their institutions from the traditional paper-based colleges of yesterday to the agile, connected campuses of today.
Working with cloud solutions built on a world-class infrastructure to powerful analytics that drive successful planning, we lead the industry in building enterprise solutions tailored to institutions around the world.
About the opportunity
Application Administrators at Ellucian perform delivery of contracted services for our Cloud customers. Ellucian cloud leverages the Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) framework in executing our day to day work; this includes request fulfillment (planned work), change management, incident management and problem management. Delivery of contracted services includes day to day hands-on keyboard work based on established ITSM standards, architecture standards, methods of procedures and troubleshooting standards

Where you will make an impact
Responsibility for and focus on delivering high uptime for our customers
Execute operational and maintenance activities via planned work
Ensure assigned technical work is planned prior to designated window
Validate supplemental teams needs to finalize assigned work are available and assigned
Execute assigned work based on plan, and designated maintenance window
Follow change management standards
Follow runbooks for common tasks
Recommend improvements to runbooks
Cover assigned rotation as an on-call resource
Participate in hand off processes/calls to ensure service delivery objectives are met consistently across all global teams
Incident Management
Rapidly troubleshoot incidents:
By leveraging service restorative actions
By understanding what causes most issues and the actions to mitigate those on your assigned technology stack
By understanding what actions will systematically eliminate the causes of common issues
Without doing more harm to currently impacted systems
Resolve incidents that Associate level cannot and incidents that escalate due to duration or impact
Engage appropriate support teams, including Engineers, to focus on increasing customer uptime
Create run books to address future occurrences of issue by clearly documenting steps taken to resolve the incident
Respond to tickets in a timely manner (meeting SLO’s)
Use and contribute to knowledge management documents for the scope of the related method of procedure
Communicate with Enterprise Operations Center regarding monitors
Interface with Cloud Assurance Managers, Application Managers and peers to ensure appropriate prioritization and quality
Report problems when incidents are recognized repeatedly at a given customer or across multiple customers
Participate in scheduled incident Post Mortems
Participate in post mortem meeting and discussion; providing and documenting details from the incident
Provide technical detail and assist with documenting agreed upon root cause
Provide technical detail and assist with documenting agreed upon preventative measures
Provide technical detail and assist with documenting a method of procedure in the event of a similar future incident
Be aware of team culture and drive positive cultural adoption
Act as a mentor for Application Administrator colleagues by:
Leading adoption of standards and best practices
Participating as a subject matter expert on process improvement; and training & tool development

What you will bring
Administration and troubleshooting of web servers and web applications running on Tomcat, Apache; Tomcat preferred
5+ years of experience with Oracle Relational Database Administration (11g and 12c), installation, and configuration management
5+ years of experience with Cloud scale Linux Administration
Proven experience providing tier two operations and support in a multi-customer cloud environment
Experience in Shell, Perl, Ruby, Python, PowerShell or similar scripting languages to automate common tasks.
Working knowledge of Jenkins, Ansible, Terraform or similar deployment tools.
ITIL v3 or v4 Foundation certification
Experience troubleshooting application and service issues, implementing and communicating technical solutions
Demonstrated experience to resolve issues and restore service quickly
Possesses the tenacity to delve to the root of the issue quickly, understand why it happened, and prevent it in the future
Proven ability to collaborate with team members to achieve successful customer outcomes
Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies, methods, and tools quickly
Strong verbal and written skills, excellent customer service, as well as high attention to detail
Preferred hands-on operational experience with Amazon Web Services with AWS certification ( AWS Certified DevOps, AWS Certified SysOps or AWS Solutions Architect certification preferred

Title: Senior Oracle SOA Integration Engineer
Description:
Company Summary

Trek Bicycle is a global leader in the design and manufacture of bicycles and related products. Trek believes the bicycle can be a simple solution to many of the world’s most complex problems and is committed to breaking down the barriers that prevent people from using bicycles more often for transportation, recreation, and inspiration. Our mission is to create products we love and take care of our customers. We value our team, making sure the best is on the field. We value new ideas from anywhere, inspiring others with our positive energy, dealing with reality to make the tough calls, and getting things done fast- turning ideas into reality.
Position Description
The Oracle SOA Integrator will be made up of 60% development and 40% system administrator responsibilities. The development role includes developing and enhancing Oracle fusion middleware, including SOA composites, to meet ongoing business requirements. The administrator role includes system configuration, system monitoring, production deployment, upgrade and server patching of Oracle servers. This position will work collaboratively with functional, technical and development teams working at company headquarters in Waterloo, WI.
Responsibilities
As a SOA Developer – you will build, test and deploy SOA composites to provide a foundational architecture for integrating various systems using Oracle fusion middleware SOA suite.
As a SOA Administrator – you will configure, monitor, upgrade and patch Oracle fusion middleware SOA suite instances in PRE-PROD and PROD deployments
Requirements
5+ years of Hands on experience with Oracle Fusion Middleware products like Oracle SOA suite and Oracle B2B
2+ years of SOA development experience.
Knowledge of various protocols: AS2, FTP, SFTP, HTTP(S), etc.
Knowledge on message formats like XML, IDOC formats and EDI formats like X12 and EDIFACT
Experience with IDE’s like JDeveloper and Oracle B2B document editor.
Knowledge on Oracle Enterprise Manager
Experience on Weblogic administration, monitoring, patching and performance tuning
1+ years of Java programming experience.
2+ Oracle DBA, Java JDK Installation, configuration and patching experience
Knowledge of Linux and Windows platforms
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
Ability to work with both functional and technical personnel.
Excellent communication and documentation skills. Experience working with all levels of the business to define requirements as well as to perform application support.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task if needed
Excellent problem-solving skills
Excellent organization skills and the ability to achieve results within tight deadlines.
Excellent writing skills, with the ability to express strategy, technical knowledge, processes in an easily understood presentation.
Additional Skills
Experience with JD Edwards EnterpriseOne ERP
Knowledge of IBM iSeries
