Title: Time & Attendance Administrator
Description:
Assists in the accurate preparation, processing, and balancing of time and attendance system to support compensation processes and play a vital role in ensuring compliance with various legislations.
Assists with the proper operation of the time and attendance system; understands time reporting rules and requirements; monitors the system for proper functioning.
Initiates and monitors helpdesk inquiries; escalates for appropriate resolution
Troubleshoots and resolves basic issues.
Contributes to the timely and accurate resolution of time and attendance system issues which may include historical edits, password resets, access requests, time management reporting.
Serves as an internal resource on payroll and time management topics.
Provide superior customer service—respond courteously, accurately and in a timely fashion to time and attendance questions and requests.
Provides input to continuous improvement projects and initiatives; supports the development and maintenance of time and attendance process documentation.
Ensures data completeness and accuracy that meets pay cycle deadlines including required approvals.
Ensures data meets all legal, contractual, and governance requirements.
Qualifications
Skills
Human Resources Data Management - Acts on people data to ensure completeness, accuracy and compliance with company policy and legislative requirements.

Human Resources Business Process Execution - Manages the execution of Human Resources business processes, seeking efficiency, accuracy, positive business performance outcomes and operational agility; integrates activities across processes as needed; assures compliance with process and legal requirements; effectively balances process requirements and business leader needs.

Action oriented - Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.

Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.

Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.

Decision quality - Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.

Being resilient - Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations.

Demonstrates self-awareness - Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.

Self-development - Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels.

Instills trust - Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.

Optimizes work processes - Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Education, Licenses, Certifications
College, university, or equivalent degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field or equivalent experience required.

Key Responsibilities:
· Administers and processes Time and Attendance data according to internal procedures.
· Ensures Attendance data is prepared and processed accurately and timely, Perform weekly as well as need basis reconciliation between OneSource and Kronos.
· Regular task would include generating Exception Dashboard, Headcount Reconciliation, run sign off reports, Final Data validation (Leave without pay, Overtime, Historical data, Night shift data, leave taken data, Leave balance data, work days data).
· Resolution of Queries or Revert to the Queries and subsequent track till closure.
· Conduct Helpdesk as per schedule.
· Actuary valuation of Leave Balances on half yearly basis for all scope entities.

Title: Global MTA Messaging Engineer
Description:
Mission
It is the mission of the Messaging team to provide best in class email, push notification, and sms delivery and to drive global adoption of Messaging best practices. Messaging works in partnership with all stakeholders (Engineering, Marketing, Legal & Compliance, Customer Service teams) with a focus on how to achieve a seamless sending process through our internal Mail Transfer Agent (MTA) infrastructure. The Messaging team provides a flexible and scalable messaging platform that integrates downstream from internal Push Marketing solutions connecting to external Internet Service Providers (ISPs).
Summary
The Global MTA Messaging Engineer is responsible for actively monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting all aspects of Groupon’s MTA infrastructure. This includes but is not limited to custom email, push notification, and sms on prem solutions. They will help to develop and implement fault tolerant designs from the physical to application layer, configure monitoring and alerting, provision and configure new services, identify and work to resolve ongoing problems, and communicate best practices within Engineering Operations and other stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Ownership of a global MTA platform sending mass email, push notification, and sms in all Groupon regions
Ensure optimal server performance and stability exists to maximize uptime and delivery rates
Maintain a global production and staging MTA environment across three data centers in North America and EMEA
Perform problem recognition and analyze the root cause of messaging issues across all protocols (smtp, smpp, mobile push, mta-haproxy)
Work with Deliverability and Analytics teams to pinpoint delivery issues as they arise and work with stakeholders to recommend the best path to resolution
Work closely with Product and Engineering teams to build out a best in class email and push notification MTA platform
Liaise with stakeholders such as Deliverability, Analytics & Automation, Rocketman, Push Marketing, Netops, Sys-Eng, and other teams as required
Collaborate with Messaging vendors as required
Be available for after hours on call support

Requirements
Appropriate technical background (bachelor in computer science, engineering or similar required)
5+ years as a system administrator or messaging engineer
3+ years in a development role pushing new features/code in a messaging environment
3+ years experience working with a large, production installation (+1 billion annual messages) with strict SLA and uptime requirements
3+ years experience with server deployment or tooling packages such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet
3+ years experience with commercial MTA platforms/products - Momentum, PowerMTA, etc.
Experience with Sparkpost Momentum
Experience using Lua as a scripting language
Experience with APNs and FCM push notification and sms delivery operations
High level understanding of DNS & how it affects message delivery
Beginner level understanding of networking concepts and how it affects message delivery
Ability to adapt communication content, message, and terminology based on the audience expressing ideas in a succinct manner using plain language
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision to reach team goals and proactively seek assistance as required
Flexible with changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Available for after hours on call support

Title: Engineering Manager
Description:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Bengaluru and Hyderabad due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India; Hyderabad, Telangana, India
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience, including technical management of software developers and system administrators/architects.
Experience designing and implementing distributed systems.

Preferred qualifications:
12 years of relevant hands-on technical management experience of software developers and systems administrators/architects.
5 years of experience in leading highly-complex, technically-challenging, cross-functional software oriented projects from inception to delivery.
Experience leading a team of Software Engineers focused on improving developer velocity, scalability, or testability
Experience providing technical expertise throughout the product life cycle including design, implementation, and delivery of scalable build/test/release infrastructure.
Experience defining team strategy and roadmap for the adoption of developer tools and test infrastructure for one or more products.
Excellent C++, Java and/or Python skills.
About the job
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you guide the way.
Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Engage and manage a team of software engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
Have technical ownership of the product.

Title: Senior Network Design and Implementation Engineer.
Description:
We Believe in Better!
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.
At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.
Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making a positive impact on enhancing the quality of life to help make this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!
Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth , CloudForte , Intelliserve
What success looks like in this role:
'Key Responsibilities:
Provides tier 3 support and assists with project implementation within the networking environment.
Successful provisioning as well as supervision of, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware, software, and related infrastructure. This also includes the installation of new systems, rebuilding existing systems, configuration of hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with customer/ government standards.
Configuration management of Local Area Networks (LANs), Wide Area Networks (WANs), network segments, and Internet and Intranet systems to ensure operability. Installation and maintenance, network hardware and software, analyze problems, and monitor networks to ensure their availability to users.
Maintains, monitors and troubleshoots within the roles of Incident Management (Return-to-Service) and/or Problem Management (Reason for Outage).
Evaluates a system’s performance and identifies user needs based on approved software per customer specifications.
• Supports acquisition of hardware and software as well as subcontractor services as needed. •Works independently on specific projects or may act as lead or Project Manager or a technical consultant where experience and knowledge span multiple projects.

Works closely with network operations, systems and other groups on business projects, assignments, problems, etc.
• Develops advanced technological ideas and guides their development to a final product or solution. • Ensures user environments are configured per requirements or baselines. • Determines and pursues courses of action necessary to obtain desired outputs, whether solutions or products, which may include baseline performance (SLA’s, etc.), Incident management and Problem Management.
• Ensures proper documentation for the corporate knowledgebase, including design, procedural and lessons learned. This also includes maintaining and updating existing documentation. • Monitors the Network and System Enterprise with provided tools to ensure the health of the critical client solutions.
Maintains on-call availability to respond to network issues and up-time; must be flexible and available with the scheduling.
Contributes to technical artifacts through team/program SharePoint and/or communities of practice.
• Staffs projects and maintain the resource plan. • Assigns and reviews tasks, provides mentoring, manages performance feedback, training and professional development opportunities to help individuals reach their full potential.
Manages the performance of internal and external service providers in order to ensure the implementation of deliverables and resulting client satisfaction. Interfaces with sub-contractors.

University degree or equivalent education and experience.
Minimum of 10 years domain experience.
Expert knowledge in evaluating vendor products and making recommendations to purchase hardware and software.
Knowledgeable in setting up administrator and service accounts.
• Knowledgeable in network security procedures, best practices, and implementation . • Ability to troubleshoot software issues and customer applications as required .
Has achieved industry standard certifications, e.g.: Security+, CCNP, CCNA, Network+, MCSA.
Excellent documentation skills are required.

Title: Director - Data Management - Global Healthcare Consulting Fi...
Description:
Apply
share this job
Email Job
Save Job
Opportunity to build and scale data management business
Drive thought leadership in data journey for top pharma companies
About Our Client
Our client is a specialised health care solutions company with a unique blend of life science domain expertise and state-of-the-art technology capabilities. Headquartered in Bangalore, with offices across the world,it is a partner to most of the world's Top 25 pharma companies helping transform their commercial and medical operations. It helps global health care organisations address complex challenges by seamlessly integrating Analytics, Technology, Operations and Medical expertise. It is also at the forefront of innovation to transform regulatory, medical and commercial operations and drive thought leadership in the journey from generation and analysis of data to creation of content to personalisation of stakeholder experiences.
Job Description
Reporting into the Vice President of Data and Analytics, you will be responsible for
Promote the use of BI and cognitive technologies to share analytical insights to support decision making, effective data governance and enforcing policies / standards
Direct and oversee the design and development of systems used for managing data such as data warehouses, data stores, and other business intelligence systems
Maintain and monitor the data systems to ensure they meet clients needs
Strategize data collection, master data management, Enterprise data warehousing and data governance and policies that ensure safe, compliant and ethical use of data both internally and externally and drive growth
Develop client's business with enterprise data management and governance solutions and IP strategy
Strengthen the organisation's partnership with existing and new clients, partners to work for different programs, and contribute to create a new growth strategy with new capabilities
Bring deep expertise into client discussions in aspects like handling of digital and health care data, real world challenges of aggregating multiple sources, technical matters such as data integrity challenges etc. and concepts of data visualisation and converting data to insights
Act as Data/Information Architect and Database Administrator in support of the core internal business application development team
Perform analysis to understand business problems and business data to provide guidance on appropriate Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Warehouse (DWH) solutions
Build a reputation for excellence in the transmission, storage, and proportionate use of data, common data standards, API's, interoperability and ensure our services are aligned to strict legal, regulatory, ethical and privacy controls
The Successful Applicant
To be successful as Director Data Management - you should have
10 plus years of experience in the field of data management, date engineering, data warehousing and business intelligence with 2-3 years exposure in the pharma/life sciences or health care domain
Strong expertise in data management from on-prem to cloud environment (AWS or Azure)
Ability to effectively interact and engage customer groups through multiple communication channels
In depth understanding of Enterprise Information Management (EIM), Data governance, Stewardship, Measurements, Master data Management(MDM) and Meta-data definitions
Having performed a role of similar size and scope, with responsibility for the iterative development and leadership of a large sector leading analytics service
Having defined and delivered at least one enterprise wide data analytics strategy in an organisation of a similar scale and complexity, with specific responsibility for its technical delivery
Having contributed to the definition, delivery and maximisation of a range of relevant, robust data and analytics offerings, re-usable products and services, in support of a broad range of corporate objectives (including oversight of a production environment)
Understanding of the life-science and marketing scenario of Global Markets, including key landscape factors such as health reforms, regulatory changes/pressures, HCP priorities etc.
Ability to measure overall governance effectiveness, quality of data and organisational data maturity and defined data standards across the enterprise
What's on Offer
As Director Data Management you role will be to strategise data collection, master data management, Enterprise data warehousing and data governance and policies that ensure safe, compliant and ethical use of data both internally and externally and drive growth. This position will be based out of India, Bangalore and may involve travel as need be.

Title: Contract Specialist
Description:
In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.
The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.
Want to be a part of our team?
The Contracts Specialist is the mid- level job in the Contract Lifecycle Management job family, reporting to a senior manager and taking their guidance from the Senior Contracts Specialist. They operate in medium complexity environments and deal with medium to large clients at a business unit or regional level.

The Contracts Specialist negotiates, agrees and compiles legally binding contracts between Dimension Data and client or vendors with the view of establishing a mutually favourable operating relationship. The Contracts Specialist partners with commercial and bid office colleagues to create contracts for medium sized to larger deals according to the regional definition. They take responsibility for the managing the entire contract life cycle from contract administration, activation, renewal and deactivation.
Working at NTT
Contract Compilation
Contracts Specialists develop a deep understanding of the product solution or service required by the client to define the best contractual agreement between Dimension Data and the client. Their intention is to minimise risk and optimise revenue for Dimension Data whilst ensuring optimal value is received by the client. They also apply their knowledge of the business to establish contracts with vendors and sub-contractors.

They partner with the sales organisation and other internal stakeholders to ensure that products and services are offered or procured with appropriate competitive terms and conditions to ensure profitability for Dimension Data.

They take responsibility for drafting and compiling baseline contracts for straight sales opportunities or for requests for proposal and tender activities. They focus on:

master agreements with service definitions
service level agreements
scope of work
financial details
contract terms and conditions,
licensing agreements

They are very good at creating clear and succinct documentation and writing business correspondence.

Contract Management
The Contracts Specialist identifies risks associated with contracts and make recommendations to mitigate and eliminate these risks. They are party to negotiating contract terms with clients or vendors and they are responsible for noting and applying agreed changes to revised contracts. They advise on contract deviations and non-standard contract clauses. It is their responsibility to ensure legal compliance for all contracts under their control.

During the contracting process, the Contracts Specialist acts as main point of contact for clients or vendors and they drive the process of obtaining approvals, applying changes and pursuing review cycles. They will also work towards the speedy finalisations of negotiation processes and ensuring that contracts are signed and finalised by all relevant parties. The Contracts Specialist will act as final point of escalation. They communicate progress in a timely way and keep all stakeholders informed.

They take full responsibility for the contract lifecycle management and ensure that the administration and management functions are performed that are required to ensure timely and professional contract finalisation. They manage the contract deactivation process as and when required and ensure the required systems are updated accordingly.

Contract Administration
The Contracts Specialist will maintain and manage contract documentation electronically and in physical formats when required. They ensure that all contract administration duties related to their contracts are executed timeously by assigned Contract Administrators. They ensure that all renewal and new billing takes place in line with the agreed process. They ensure that the relevant systems are updated with the required information from the contracts process. They review system data for accuracy and use the renewal plan to prepare renewal documentation for distribution to the relevant clients.

Stakeholder Management
They will also establish relationships with vendors and partners when required to obtain relevant contract details and to negotiate terms of engagement. They act as advisors to management and other colleagues regarding contractual rights and obligations and when required they assist in interpreting contractual terms and conditions.

Reporting
Contracts Specialists maintain contract logs and they compile reports on contract activity, distributing these to the relevant forums.

Behavioural skills
They recommend improvements to policies and processes and help to implement improvements. These employees have a good working knowledge of contractual legislation and they are proficient in structuring of contracts and all associated parts. They need to be skilled at negotiation and able to achieve agreement amongst stakeholders with varying viewpoints.

They have good analytic ability and above average financial skills. Their ability to work well with internal teams and to communicate clearly contributes to their success in the position.

Required Work Experience:
6 – 8 years’ work experience,
4 years specific experience within a related environment
What will make you a good fit for the role?
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.
Equal opportunity employer
NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

Title: Office Administrator
Description:

Job: Office Administrator
Location: Faridabad
Shaping energy solutions to empower sustainable connectivity.
We combine SNC-Lavalin’s project management expertise and ABB’s deep technological knowledge to create a company dedicated to substations – we are Linxon.
Linxon is a joint venture company set up by SNC-Lavalin and ABB to turnkey electrical AC substation projects. Linxon will undertake turnkey electrical alternating current substation projects related to renewable and conventional power generation, power transmission and transportation solutions. Turnkey solutions will include project design, engineering, procurement, construction, management, commissioning and after-sales support.
Linxon – A Leading Engineering Company:
As one of the leading engineering companies, we help our customers with turnkey solutions in the field of substations for power transmission, renewable energy and transportation.
As a single point of contact we combine the accumulated knowhow of key-suppliers and contractors so that customers benefit from efficient solutions, increased industrial productivity and a lower environmental impact in a sustainable way.
Job Brief:
The Office Administrator will be a member of Linxon location Management Team and will contribute towards the effective operation and facility management. This role is to perform a variety of administrative tasks and duties include providing support to entire business team, in daily office needs and managing our company’s general administrative activities.
This role also requires supporting multiple activities including support to new recruits/transferred employees in finding accommodation & school, arranging local transportation etc, handling day-to-day local employees’ issues related to administration, arranging team meeting/outings with all local support, coordination for medical check-ups/emergency, coordinating for interview scheduling of employees/external resources, documentation collection etc. The office administrator ensures smooth running of our company’s offices and contributes in driving sustainable growth.

Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Coordinate office procedures and resolve administrative issues.
Develop and update administrative systems to make them more efficient.
Assist colleagues whenever necessary
Greet and assist overseas/local visitors to the office.

Proven experience as an office administrator, office assistant or relevant role
Knowledge of office management systems and procedures
Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Title: Associate Data Analysts (EPM)
Description:
Company Description:
At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.
Job summary:
The Red Hat IT Enterprise Applications team is looking for an EPM Data Analyst with a background in financial planning and analysis or accounting to join us in Pune, India. In this role, you will be responsible for Hyperion and Anaplan administration, data loads, user training, system support, and enhancements of the enterprise performance management (EPM) toolsets. This position will also be a part of the implementation of OneStream EPM. You'll need to have a high attention to detail and a proven ability to understand complex financial problems. You'll also need great communication skills and a global focus, as the core set of responsibilities are global by nature.
Primary job responsibilities:
Consolidate Excel files, perform validations on them and upload to Hyperion
Serve as a data subject matter expert for data reconciliations, data troubleshooting, budget adjustment summary
Provision users to Anaplan
Migrate code to production for Anaplan
Administer Financial Close Management templates, schedules and tasks
Administer Account Reconciliation Manager profiles, profile segments, reconciliations and assignments
Load and reconcile data monthly to Hyperion Planning, Essbase and ARM
Assist with the implementation and migration of Hyperion to OneStream EPM
Maintain other functional admin and user documentation, checklists
Proactively build working relationships with the Hyperion and Anaplan users to deliver, maintain and enhance application functionality
Ensure production environment stability and performance are up to par and meet service level agreements (SLAs)
Ensure compliance with all applicable change management processes and procedures including internal controls
Provide timely response and resolution of emergency production questions, issues and defects
Required skills:
Finance and accounting background, deep functional understanding of budgeting and forecasting
1+ yrs experience in Hyperion (11.1.2.4 preferred) as an administrator or power user
1+ yrs experience in Anaplan or other EPM toolset
Advanced Excel and SmartView skills
Excellent understanding of Google docs, sheets, and slides
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or in fields related to Finance or Accounting
Curious individual with solid initiative and ability to work in a self-directed environment

Title: Azure Cloud Engineer
Description:
Greetings from BlackwaterTech!!
BlackwaterTech is a UK-based software company which provides IT solutions to the US and UK market.
Role: Azure Cloud Engineer
Role Description: The Azure Cloud Engineer would need to have at least 3 to 5 years of experience. This Candidate's primary responsibilities include responsibility for the design/planning, management, support, and oversight of the environment.
The Azure Cloud Engineer would assist with the management, support, and oversight of the virtual server environments and business continuity processes. This Candidate will assist with managing, maintaining, monitoring and securing (including data security) of all servers including installations, upgrades, patches and documentation.
The Azure Cloud Engineer will work across the enterprise to coordinate with the various stakeholders. This is an experienced individual contributor position that will work with cross-functional team members for day-to-day activities.
The Azure Cloud Engineer will be accountable for meeting deliverable commitments including schedule and quality compliance. This Candidate must have skills to plan and schedule own work activities, coordinate activities with other cross-functional team members to meet project goals.
Responsibilities:
- To conceptualize, design and deliver product/sustenance delivery through the team as per defined scope and standards in a particular technology.
- Reviews on the architecture and design deliverables and support as an SME.
- Ensure knowledge up-gradation and work with new technologies so that the solution is current and meets quality standards and the client requirements.
- Gather specifications and deliver solutions to the client organization based on understanding of a domain or technology.
- Recommend client value creation initiatives and implement industry best practices.
- Train and develop team so as to ensure that there is an adequate supply of trained manpower in the said technology and deliver risks are mitigated.
- Design and develop solution for product/project and sustenance delivery.
- Effectively present public and hybrid cloud-based architectural design concepts and solutions to all levels in the organization.
- Drive decision making. Identify alternatives, pros and cons, and make recommendations.
- Anticipate when architectural change will be needed and prepare the organization for a successful transition.
- Build public and hybrid cloud-based, optimized reference applications, show-casing event driven, elastically scalable, fault tolerance and other cloud architecture patterns.
- Drive public and hybrid cloud-based, proof-of-concept prototypes that assess the feasibility of solutions and demonstrate to our clients how technology can be leveraged.
- Identify, analyze and resolve the most complex public and hybrid cloud-based issues.
- Identify and balance risks and rewards to meet objectives.
- Manage multiple initiatives independently.
- Establish relationships with strategic public and hybrid cloud vendors to acquire knowledge develop partnerships, and collaborate on potential architectural solutions and technology acquisitions.
- Communicates architectural solutions to IT senior leaders and other critical stakeholders throughout the architecture planning and design process.
Qualifications:
- Direct experience in Cloud platform technologies - Amazon or Microsoft Azure.
- Three (3) years’ experience and proven success in Azure design, support and management within a large-scale organization.
- Proven expert knowledge of virtual application delivery technologies and virtual desktop infrastructures including knowledge of disaster recovery concepts.
- 3+ years of recent experience as a build and deployment engineer using industry standard tools.
- Experience with deployment tools and virtual lab management.
- Experience building and deploying with Linux, UNIX and Windows technologies.
- Experience supporting and documenting build and configuration changes throughout environments.
- Understanding of industry standard system architecture and system management tools.
- Experience in the design, deployment, and support of large, complex systems.
- Ongoing management of configuration and layout of VMware virtual infrastructure.
- Optional experience in cost optimization of cloud deployments for applications.
- Proficiency with MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Visio).
Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Information Technology and/or Computer Science; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
- Three (3) years of experience and proven success in Azure design, support and management within a large-scale organization.
- Proven expert knowledge of virtual application delivery technologies and virtual desktop infrastructures including knowledge of disaster recovery concepts.
- Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP): Server Administrator on Windows Server 2012 (Preferred).
- Experience with backup technologies (Preferred).
- Working knowledge of IT Project Management techniques/processes (Preferred).
- Demonstrated experience and proven expertise in intrusion detection and remediation (Preferred).

Experience: Minimum 3-5 years

Title: Web Server Administrator - Hyderabad,TS, IN
Description:
Position Description: Follow established procedures and instructions for building web servers, releasing code updates and requesting services of other MIS team.

Provide ideas and suggestions for continuous process improvement.

Create and document system installation or update processes and present for review.

Provide technical web systems support for software development teams in Dev and Test environments.

Coordinate system support and Operating system updates with Technology Infrastructure team. Document all system changes.

Must be available for off-hours support, scheduled off-hours Production Release Deployments, and emergency response.

About the company:
Clean Harbors Inc. (www.cleanharbors.com) is a NYSE listed US based $3.3 billion company. Clean Harbors was founded in 1980 near Boston by Mr. Alan S. McKim, who today remains the company’s Chairman and CEO.

Everywhere industry meets environment, Clean Harbors is on-site, providing premier environmental, energy and industrial services. Clean Harbors employs a dedicated workforce of 15,000 employees and has over 450 service locations across the U.S., Canada and Mexico. Beyond addressing the environmental needs of its more than 300,000 customers, the Company has been on the front lines of addressing some of the largest emergency response events in North America of the past several decades including the BP Oil Spill in the Gulf of Mexico, the anthrax attacks in New York, the 2015 avian flu outbreak that devastated the poultry industry, Hurricanes Katrina, Rita and Sandy, and the oil pipeline breaks that affected the Yellowstone and Kalamazoo rivers, along with other major chemical releases into the environment.

Clean Harbors India has been strategically established as the Global Capability Center (GCC) to serve our parent company. We take pride in serving some of the most tech savvy business stakeholders at Clean Harbors. The GCC employees form part of our globally integrated teams that provide cutting-edge IT solutions and production support across platforms. Our shared services teams work seamlessly with their global counterparts in providing critical 24x7 support in various functions including Finance, HR, Procurement, IT and Operations. Our aggressive growth plans open significant career advancement opportunities for our employees.

We are operating from Skyview, Hitech City Hyderabad (http://www.theskyview.in/). Clean Harbors has substantially invested in the GCC to support its growth plans. The Company will be celebrating its 40th year in 2020 and is counting on the GCC to be a part of extending that track record of success.

Title: Data Protection Technical Consultant
Description:
The Company

Hitachi Vantara, a wholly owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., helps data-driven leaders use the value in their data to innovate intelligently and reach outcomes that matter for business and society – what we call a double bottom line. Only Hitachi Vantara combines 100+ years of experience in operational technology (OT) and 60+ years in IT to unlock the power of data from your business, your people and your machines. We help enterprises store, enrich, activate and monetize data for better customer experiences, new revenue streams and lower business costs
Primary Responsibilities:
The Data Protection L3 Administrator is responsible for the day-to-day support of the data protection environment for the assigned customer account(s).
Identify monitoring requirements and implement monitoring solutions in conjunction with the support team and Hitachi Vantara Management.
Perform health checks of the data protection application and infrastructure environments.
Perform capacity, performance, and problem management activities following HitachiVantara standards.
Perform data protection incident troubleshooting and mitigation actions upon escalation.
Open and manage 3rd-party support tickets for end-to-end data protection incident management.
Coordinate work with 3rd party vendors and HitachiVantara support teams.
Execute data protection restores for assigned customer accounts upon escalation
Provide escalation support for the data protection team as required for the assigned account(s).
Handle advanced data protection configuration changes.
Implement change requests following ITIL best practices.
Monitor incident and service request ticket queues and work on assigned tickets.
Provide daily, weekly and monthly operations metrics/reports to the Service Delivery Manager.
Identify reporting requirements and build report deliverables for the assigned account(s).
Create and modify support documentation for the data protection environment establishing guidelines in conjunction with HitachiVantara Management.
Follow the established policies, procedures and practices defined by HitachiVantara.
Identify and provide suggestions on continuous improvement initiatives within the assigned account(s).
Provide administrative support and data protection best practice recommendations for projects and initiatives for the data protection team and the assigned account(s).

Required Skills:
At least 7 years of IT support / administrative experience.
At least 5 years of administrative experience with commercial data protection application/infrastructure environments: CommVault or Netbackup
Working knowledge of data protection best practices
Administrative knowledge of storage systems, SAN, network systems, computing systems and virtualized environments.
Administrative knowledge on data protection infrastructure including VTL, tape libraries, backup appliances
Administrative experience with operating systems and database systems
Working experience with industry standard application / infrastructure monitoring tools
Working knowledge of commercial service management tools for incident, problem and change.
Basic understanding of ITIL process (Change, Incident and Problem Management).
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Information Technology or other related technology fields of study.
ITIL Certification –preferred but not mandatory.

Title: Sr Systems Admin- Full stack
Description:
Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership
CCP Sr System Administrator

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?

The Enterprise Services Compute and Connectivity Platform Organization designs, implements and operates a state-of-the-art Information Systems Infrastructure serving around 110,000 employees, in over 900 locations across 65 plus countries. We work with the latest and emerging technologies to deliver scalable, high performing, always available infrastructure services around the world. We deliver services that connect, host, virtualize, store, collaborate, integrate, compute and transact business solutions that utilizes cloud first, automation, analytics, “as a Service”, BIG data and software defined.
The CCP Manage Sr System Administrator will be responsible for operational support of Windows Server Infrastructure, hardening and architecture for >15,000 servers at Honeywell. You will work in Windows & Linux Server Architecture & Administration (Windows 2019/2016/2012 Operating Systems & *NIX) This role includes application rationalization components to best assist business teams on migration, upgrades or decommissioning of legacy Infrastructure. This role will be responsible for installing and troubleshooting Windows based applications and assisting with Automation activities.

Key Responsibilities:

Operational support on a rotational basis of > 15,000 server
Accountable for technology roadmaps related to virtualization technologies, APIs, automation and cloud adoption
Work with Hyper Converged Infrastructure technology platforms like Nutanix, Dell VXRail, Dell VRTX, Dell Flex OS to create the strategy/direction for enterprise infrastructure
Troubleshoot performance issues related to virtualized workloads
Facilitate moving of workloads to/from on-prem cloud to off-prem cloud
Participate in calls with other members to address and troubleshoot application and or infrastructure related issues

A bachelor’s Degree; preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or Business-Related Discipline

Experience with ServiceNow or another similar formal Service Management platform and/or methodology

The ability to be a change agent and promote positive change in the organization

Windows patching tools like Ivanti & WSUS and Windows security standards & OS Hardening concepts are needed.

Title: Web Developer.P2.
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled web developer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming. This person is responsible for developing front end web applications, ensuring the responsiveness of applications, developing integrations to back end systems using various web technologies. This person will be maintaining existing applications as well as designing, developing and supporting new web applications for IT Web, Portals, and Service team.
As our team is small, you will have responsibilities in all aspects of our systems development life cycle. You will be continuously learning and innovating as well as supporting and maintaining existing web applications and systems. In our environment, you will identify opportunities and problems quickly and get them resolved efficiently.
Responsibilities:
Working alongside business analysts, technical architects, and business stakeholder to understand requirements and designs
Working alongside graphic designers and business analysts for web design features
Working with system administrators for deployment and troubleshoot when there are issues
Developing front end website applications
Ensuring responsiveness of web applications
Designing user interactions on web pages
Developing back end website applications
Developing integrations to back end systems and databases for functionality
Designing and developing APIs
Seeing through a project from conception to finished product
Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages
Business Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science with 3 – 5 years of working experiences
Excellent verbal communication skills
Strong organizational and project management skills
Good problem-solving skills
Excellent team player
Attention to detail
Familiarity with agile development process such as SCRUM
Technical Requirements:
Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages and framework such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript, Django
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Angular JS, React and Amber
Proficiency with development languages and framework such as Python, Java, Jenkins, Maven, Git
Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle and MongoDB

Preferred Technical Requirements:
Familiarity with content management system such as Adobe Experience Manager and integration with Adobe Analytics and Adobe Target

Title: Technical Support Manager, L1
Description:
Digital Guardian is a collaborative group of hands-on, game changing innovators, willing to do what it takes to get the job done! We strive to engage, develop, and retain top talent by fostering an environment where individuals can succeed.
For more than 15 years, Digital Guardian has enabled data-rich organizations to protect their most valuable assets with an on premises deployment or an outsourced managed security program (MSP). Digital Guardian sets the standard on how to protect data!
Currently, we are looking for a highly motivated Technical Support Manager, L1, to join a fast-paced Pre-IPO security company that is experiencing strong growth. The Manager of Technical Support will lead a 5-10-person global team of Associate Software Support Engineers. The successful candidate will oversee the service, support and maintenance in connection with the post-sales support of company’s product line. The Manager will be responsible for developing and executing customer service strategy, meeting key performance metrics and for executing service level attainment with a heavy focus on customer satisfaction. Keeping our customers happy and meeting their needs is the top priority for this position.
Your responsibilities will include:
Develop and utilize effective forecasting and capacity planning tools to accurately predict required staffing.
Work closely with sales managers and operations teams to develop a comprehensive annual customer plan and roadmap.
Manage customer escalations effectively and in a timely manner.
Oversee quality assurance including issue resolution, call monitoring, and development of customer performance metrics.
Establish and execute processes to make the team more efficient and productive.
Manage resources by setting clear expectations, creating accountability, and enhancing collaboration to exceed service level and quality expectations.
Deliver reports and analysis to members of the leadership team including evaluation of overall performance, trend identification, best practices, problem resolution, and risk mitigation.
Serve as liaison to other departments to gather service requirements and implement customer service initiatives in support of products and services.
Act as a resource and role model for all members of the Customer Service organization.
Act as a customer support representative – accept incoming support requests through phone, chat, and email channels. Answer customer requests and handle them expeditiously and professionally. Proactively communicate and accurately set customer expectations.
Manage each assigned support issue to successful resolution.
Develop training plans for the team to ensure we are constantly building up our internal knowledge.
Build out our knowledge base to help drive self-service support
Provide “hands-on” support using broad base of knowledge as an IT generalist or systems administrator.
Troubleshoot application crashes, system crashes (BSOD) and application and system hangs.
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
BS degree in Computer Science or Technology related program or equivalent experience in a technical support role.
Five years’ experience in supporting enterprise class software or systems for external customers (not in-house IT support).
0-3 years of management experience, including demonstrated experience in both customer support and software development. Demonstrated Management success, performance assessments and team building experience.
Ability to lead, influence and motivate both teams and individuals towards the company's objectives, and toward the delivery of clear client value.
Solid analytical and problem-solving abilities. Sound, independent judgment. Highly organized.
High energy and enthusiasm for delivering services
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Creative, flexible and innovative.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications (Excel, Word, etc.).
Strong knowledge of desktop Windows operating systems (Windows 7, 8, 10).
Experience working with virtualization technologies like VMWare, Citrix, etc., is required.
Knowledge of Linux/Unix/macOS is a significant advantage, but not required.
24/7 operation, this position may require shift, weekend work or on call rotation.
Not Required but helpful
Industry recognized technical certifications MCP, MCDBA, MCSE, CISSP, CISA, etc.
Exposure to common scripting languages like VBScript, Power Shell, Java Script, Shell Script, etc. and SQL scripting for MS SQL Server and basic DBA skills.
Exposure to Microsoft Windows server technologies (2012/2016/2019)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft debugging tools (windbg, procmon, debug view)
Knowledge of programming languages is helpful.
What We Offer:
Competitive salaries
Full benefit packages
Collaborative environment
State of the art technology
Career Growth
Digital Guardian is a global organization headquartered in Waltham, MA.
Secure your Career at Digital Guardian!

Title: Sr Applications Dev Analyst
Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
SharePoint Administrator

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?
Support and execute the IT strategy critical to the transformation of Honeywell to a contemporary, connected organization. You will help define standards for IT services that include SharePoint platform and applications. You will support adoption of software solutions leading to productivity improvements and identify best in class IT capabilities that can be integrated across end user platforms. You will be the end-user advocate, focusing on compliance and user experience provided by IT solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Maintain and administer Microsoft SharePoint OnPrem and Online Environment, including daily monitoring, troubleshooting and performance analysis; SharePoint Subject Matter Expert (SME).
Provide technical guidance to the team in the technologies related to the support of an Enterprise SharePoint environment (understanding relationship with active directory, SQL, AAD, IIS, etc).
Works with various Project Managers to facilitate the deployment of new SharePoint sites within the existing SharePoint 2013/2016 Intranet/DMZ hosting environment, Submits and maintains firewall rule requests (FWRR) including any required EMS Security Exceptions.
Submits required architecture exceptions where deviations to Honeywell standards are required to reduce costs or meet project demands.
Assists in defining system architecture standards for the various Business Units. Responsible for deployment across the Enterprise.
Assesses fit of customer and system requirements with standard Enterprise infrastructure and applications, to determine adaptation with standard tool set requirements.
Responsible for providing application and code deployment services in support of programs during the implementation phase.
Evaluates the overall customer demand for IT services.
Helps ensure that systems design requirements will meet both Honeywell Architecture and Security standards.
Develops governance activities to ensure compliance with architecture standards.
Ensures optimum system efficiency by refreshing the systems and recommending enhancements to maintain or improve system integrity.
Investigates and implements technological solutions to support business unit needs.
Analyzes technology industry and market trends to recommend technology strategy that best supports system and customer needs and overall business strategy
YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other IT/technical degree
6+ years of experience SharePoint
4+ years online and/or SharePoint Administration (2013, 2016, O365)
4+ years of experience with Windows Server technologies including: Windows Server 2016/2012, Active Directory, IIS 7, ISA/TMG, SQL Server
4+ years experience with Microsoft Office System and its integration with SharePoint and service
applications
Must be a US Citizen due to export control applications and data
WE VALUE

Certifications in SharePoint or Agile/Scrum
Able to multitask within an environment of rapidly changing priorities.
Able to work through difficult issues in an effective, pragmatic fashion.
Able to work in a team environment and communicate well to all levels of management.
Must possess good organizational and facilitation skills including the ability to prioritize, coordinate, and manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously
Have an outstanding attitude and a desire to ensure customer success
Capability to work with little management oversight must have strong personal initiative; Have a strong desire to grow technically and professionally

Additional Information

Category: Information Technology
Location: Devarabisanahalli Village, KR Varturhobli,,East Taluk - Phase I,Bangalore,KARNATAKA,560103,India

Title: NOC Engineer
Description:
At Rockstar Games, we create the games we would want to play ourselves.

A career at Rockstar is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding, large-scale projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a friendly, inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar India is on the lookout for a talented NOC Engineer who possess a passion for 24x7 Network Operations Surveillance and Support. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in Bangalore, India.
WHAT WE DO
This role involves 24x7 network surveillance and the buildout of monitoring networks and systems across several IT environments.
The NOC team manages the design and implementation of new systems and is the escalation point for complex technical problems.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide technical guidance to NOC Administrators while supporting 24x7 rotational shifts.
Periodically check application and system health to support NOC Administrators.
Day to day administration of 1000+ Windows/Linux servers, including related applications.
Manage and support local site VMWare multi-cluster environment.
Perform Level 1, Level 2, and/or, Level 3 administration of Microsoft Active Directory.
Administer monitoring services such as Systems Center Operations Manager, Check_MK, Splunk, and AppDynamics.
Record and respond to system events in accordance with established procedures.
Correlate multiple monitoring system events and application status to ensure proper diagnosis.
Troubleshoot and resolve system related issues. Update existing runbooks and/or develop new runbooks as required.
Determine severity and urgency of an incident and take immediate action to restore service; escalating to Engineering staff as necessary.
Ensure established communications structure is followed during system impacting events.
Lead and direct troubleshooting efforts during P1 incidents.
Ensure NOC Administrators can provide health status updates on production and development platforms.
Look for improvements and offer recommendations to existing process and documentation.
Protect players' experience by applying initiative and sound judgment while adhering to established incident management tools.
Identify events requiring new runbook and work with management to complete development.
Serve as escalation point to NOC staff to support 24x7x365 coverage efforts.
Perform control access management activities and conduct patch/remediation efforts.
Lead and perform other duties as assigned by your supervisor.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in CS and/or equivalent experience.
Minimum 5 years' experience in an I.T. and/or NOC role.
2+ years' experience with MS SQL, VMware, and IIS including related technologies and standards such as DHCP, DNS, DFS, LDAP, IPSEC, CIFS, SMB, etc.
Possess a thorough understanding of Microsoft Windows Server Operating System, Active Directory & Microsoft SQL in an enterprise environment.
Must understand the principles of TCP/IP based networks.
Ability to work independently and possess superior skills in troubleshooting and issue resolution.
Strong sense of urgency with a passion for accuracy and timeliness.
Ability to work calmly in high pressure situations and manage multiple ongoing projects.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills and problem-solving skills.
Thorough understanding of monitoring and reporting tools.
Proven experience in a fast paced, time sensitive environment.
Self-motivated in learning and enhancing technical skills to increase job effectiveness.
As part of the 24x7 network surveillance team, this position requires participating in 9 and/or 12-hour rotational shifts as necessary.
SKILLS
Working knowledge of highly complex IT systems.
Strong analytical thinking.
Strong understanding of network topology and strong troubleshooting skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and professionally.
Attention to detail. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Experience and training in Incident Management and Business Processes; ITIL, Six Sigma.
Strong problem-solving skills.
PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
6+ years' experience with supporting large online environments.
Strong background in Windows/Linux server configuration, administration, and monitoring.
Experience with any monitoring and support tools such as: Grafana, Cloudwatch, Graphite, InfluxDB, Check_MK, AppDynamics, Splunk, New Relic.
Ability to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities.
Strong knowledge of networking concepts.
HOW TO APPLY
Please apply with a CV and cover-letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.

Description:

IT Data Operations Engineer

Do you want to be at the forefront of data warehousing and analytics capabilities? Do you accept the challenge of managing and operating with in-memory technologies that deliver game changing business value?
Micron Technology is hiring data operations engineers to be part of our IT Data Operations Team within the Enterprise Analytics and Data organization. The Data Operation team works closely with development team and Micron’s business functions in all aspects of data, data warehousing, and business intelligence supporting and maintaining data assets and Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. We are looking for individuals with datawarehousing, database and ETL development skills to be part of our IT Operations team. This role will work primarily with SQL Server, Oracle, Microsoft BI Stack, SAP BW/SSIS ETL tools and native SAP HANA development in an in-memory data warehouse environment.

Work in a shift based rotational schedule

Participate and learn new solutions through condensed knowledge transfer sessions

0-3 years of relevant work experience in Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, and Analytics.
0-3 years of experience working with databases, PL-SQL, T-SQL and ETL (Microsoft SSIS) tools.

Data Vault, Inmon, or Kimball data architecture knowledge is a plus
A passion for data and information with strong analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.

Experience with various technologies, frameworks and processes, such as Agile, Microsoft BI Suite, Tableau, Microsoft SQL Server, SAP (ECC, APO, SLT, BW, Business Objects, and HANA), data warehousing, data flow mapping, requirements gathering, testing and data validation techniques.

The ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, work environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to work under minimal supervision.

Title: Security Administrator - Fresher
Description:
We are looking for a Security Administrator to be responsible for desktop, mobile, and network security, troubleshooting network access and implementing network security policies and procedures at our organization. The Security Administrator works independently within the established procedures to ensure network security access and protect against unauthorized access, modifications, or destruction. Your responsibilities include performing risk assessments, audits, staff training sessions, and monitoring network activity.
To be a successful Security Administrator, you should be meticulous and detail-oriented, with excellent technical and information security skills. You should be skilled at drafting security policies and training less technically skilled employees to be security conscious.
Security Administrator Responsibilities:
Installing, administering, and troubleshooting network security solutions.
Updating software with the latest security patches and ensuring the proper defenses are present for each network resource.
Performing vulnerability and penetration tests, identifying and defending against threats, and developing disaster recovery plans.
Configuring security systems, analyzing security requirements, and recommending improvements.
Monitoring network traffic for suspicious behavior.
Creating network policies and authorization roles and defending against unauthorized access, modifications, and destruction.
Consulting with staff, managers, and executives about the best security practices and providing technical advice.
Configuring and supporting security tools, such as firewalls and anti-virus software.

Security Administrator Requirements:
An Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Cyber Security, or a related field.
Advanced training certifications may be advantageous.
A strong understanding and knowledge of computer, network, and security systems.
Good teaching, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

Title: Senior Technical Specialist
Description:
1) Responsible for the build out, support, maintenance, and troubleshooting of our rapidly changing infrastructure environment.
2) Responsible for moves, additions and changes to software, hardware and network as they relate to office space reorganization, facilities relocation or facilities start-up.
3) Provide general and routine technical support to a broad range of installation, patching, configuration, and updates to Operating Systems and non-OS vendor application requiring the ability to research, analyses and resolve problems effectively to meet established performance metrics for Windows platform.
4) Collaborates and contributes with team members, software vendors, and other technical staff to develop, design, implement, and continuously improve systems.
5) Must be available and be flexible on work timing for on-call to work with remote engineers when required during non-business hours and on weekends. Will be required to work at more than one site as need arises.
6) Lead and manage server infrastructure operational team including Server, Virtualization, Storage, including Backup
7) Lead and manage technical problem resolution 3rd line support.
8) Define, execute and deliver operational transformational service strategies for servers and storages, resulting in operational excellence and best in class services
9) Ensure Operations and Service Delivery, strives to improve the service, achieve operational excellence, highly customer and process focused
10) Drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the outage incident management process
11) Lead escalations and outage bridges, provide technical guidance to ensure timely resolution is provided. Ensure accurate outage status alerts are sent on timely basis.
12) Ensure documentation of RCA, corrective actions are defined and carried out
13) Direct involvement in incidents or problems that cause service impact and acts as escalation point for incidents not being resolved in a timely manner.
14) Monitors and evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of infrastructure service delivery methods and procedures.
15) Senior Server Administrator with strong System and Datacenter experience.
16) Experience with Server Capacity Management Pro, actively monitoring tools, deep knowledge in best practice of Servers Farm Management, Patch Management
17) Active Directory, DNS, DHCP experience, specifically: configuring and troubleshooting domain trust, replications; Active directory - configuring and maintaining AD, DNS, DHCP and Group Policy, adding/removing Windows Server features and roles, troubleshooting using Performance Monitor, Event Viewer and Task Manager, Server OS installation and troubleshooting, strong knowledge on RAID, MS patching hardware expertise (IBM, HP, Dell, etc.)
18) Datacenter experience such as server mounting and installation for Rack and Blade Servers, knowledge on Raid Group 1/0/5/6/10, datacenter maintenance checklists and datacenter cabling.
19) Proven experience with Veeam Backup and Replication (Backup, Recovery and Replication for VMware, Backup and Recovery for Active Directory, knowledge on instant recovery, Veeam explorer for Active Directory)
20) Providing support for implementation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of IT systems, they resolve problems of the server, network devices, storage, and client devices, support IT systems of all end users on a daily basis by monitoring, and troubleshooting. Experience in basic networking is a must.
21) Engineers should be familiar with virtualization software, such as VMware and Hyper-V, scripting with PowerShell, Nutanix as well.
22) Communication with customers as required: keeping them informed of incident progress, notifying them of impending changes or agreed outages
23) Responsible for resolving escalated service issues, coaching other engineers to resolutions.
24) Able to work with minimum supervision as well as perform under pressure and meet tight deadlines
25) Maintain documented procedures for Windows Infrastructure. Responsible for creating design documents, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) or other documents as required for all ongoing business and transitioning the project to the Operation Support team.
26) Good written and verbal communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹400,000.00 to ₹500,000.00 /year
Experience:
creating design documents, SOP's & other Doc as required: 1 year (Required)
Datacenter cabling, Raid Group 1/0/5/6/10,: 1 year (Required)
escalated service issues n coaching other engineers: 2 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Work Remotely:
No

Title: ES Tech, Technical Program Manager, RPA
Description:
· · Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline
5 + years of experience in software application/product development projects
3 + years of experience in technical program management for Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Products, or other Automation platforms
Experience in implementing and maintaining systems and processes in large-scale, complex environments
Deep knowledge of system architecture/ Design Approaches and data integration
Knowledge of Agile methodologies and practices
Experience in global, cross geographical project delivery, coordination and resource management
Excellent written and verbal communications skills

The ES Technology organization delivers technology solutions to meet the needs of its parent organization Employee Services. Join the team building Amazon’s first digital HR workforce! You will be part of the team building a Smart Digital workforce by automating manual HR processes through Robotics Process Automation (RPA) as well as home grown Smart automation products, allowing the Employee Services organization to globalize their services with unlimited scalability. We have ambitious targets for adding significant business value over the next three years.
Amazon's ES Tech team is looking for a Technical Program Manager to align the customer vision to the technical solution, defining program/project strategies using Robotic Process Automation platform (UiPath) as well as home grown Smart Automation products. The person will help write the technical requirements, and manage implementation of multiple projects making sure customer strategic goals, and requirements are delivered with quality, ensuring a scalable, extensible, and maintainable solution with all cross system integrations.
The Technical Program Manager will interact with product management, cross partner teams, multiple stakeholders and leadership to deliver complex projects and programs. The person will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make trade-off decisions, and balance business needs versus technical constraints.
The person should have deep technical skills in Automation products and technologies to provide solutions, technical design, build, and delivery. This may include leading virtual technical teams to manage development, configuration, maintenance, administration, and integration with other systems. Successful candidates should have a strong technical background in RPA (Robotic Process Automation) products, and underlying technologies, be detail driven and have excellent problem solving abilities. You will have a deep understanding of product design and implementation details and will successfully represent the technical team to senior leadership and customers. Your technical expertise and operational excellence will influence the team’s decisions and drive secure and robust solutions, which have great customer experience.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead planning, execution, and delivery of individual projects.
Establish the goals and review metrics to identify opportunities and deliver success
Work independently for a successful execution of the RPA/Smart automation products/ solutions. Manage the entire product/solutions life cycle from planning till execution and then steady state as well for delivered solutions.
Work closely with Business teams to gather business requirements and write detail technical requirement specifications as per the technical constraints.
Provide technical guidance by facilitating solution/design/architectural discussions; find and research ways to utilize RPA platform to gain efficiency, productivity and scale.
Partner with system integrators, administrators, developers, architects and QA engineers to design, build, and implement enterprise RPA/Automation solutions.
Facilitate and oversee code review sessions to ensure design and configuration is consistent across the applications and compliant with standards.
Provide expertise on capacity management, level-of-effort estimation, task tracking and assignment.
Collaborate with partner teams to define deliverables and accompanying documentation for projects.
Identify, track and mitigate issues, risks, roadblocks and escalations at multiple levels.
Create and maintain and communicate project status and metrics to stakeholders.

· · Technical knowledge/certifications and experience in UiPath or other RPA products
Proficiency in HTML, Javascript, Java, SQL, C# and/or other scripting/programming languages
Experience in Cloud Architecture / Application Design, Integration with SaaS products
Experience in API development and architecture
Experience in ETL processes
Experience in Data Analytics
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer -
Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Design

Review defect fixes.

Provide transition activities.

Training and Recruitment / People Management.

Project Planning and Set up.

? Share inputs in creation of project plan.

Requirement Gathering and Analysis.

Project Support.

? Keep a close track on any changes to Requirements and impact to cost and schedule.
Business Development Support.

? Follow standard Cognizant process and estimation methodology.

Title: Windows Administrator Expert Opening
Description:
We are urgently looking for Windows Administrator for our own organization.

Freshers who have done any specialization or certification course related to this opening/skill or if have knowledge for the same and have keen interest in pursuing it as a career, may also apply.

This is an Awesome Opportunity for the individuals who are willing to take full ownership and responsibility of their tasks and wants to grow exponentially in terms of salary, knowledge and role/designation. Read more about our company in the last 2 paragraphs.

JOB LOCATION: Rohini/ Pitampura (Delhi)

JOB DESCRIPTION
Will be required to create, manage & administer (.Net, PHP, Java) websites in IIS, Apache servers.
Will be required to administer and manage SQL Server, Oracle and Mysql databases.
Must have in depth experience in Windows Administration and will be administering Windows Servers (2003, 2008, 2012) and clients.
Will be involved in domain management, Active directory, Group policies, and applying permission & rules to Windows XP & Windows 7 clients.
Will be managing antivirus, security firewall & other software installations and troubleshooting. Must have in depth knowledge of Switches, Routers, Modems, Firewalls, URL Blocking and other network related issues.
Will be administering and managing CC proxy & similar software for routing traffic through proxy server and creating rules for blocking certain websites for different types of user group.
Will be administering SVN so should have strong knowledge of SVN and other version control software.
Have to manage Network of the company and make it as secure as possible. Must have extensive experience in DNS, DHCP, Lease Lines etc.
Have to maintain and secure company's email by setting up an email server. Experience in Hmail Server and Exchange server is preferred.
Will be maintaining complete IT Infrastructure and hardware requirements (eg: making patch cords, switches, routers). Should be able to repair & fix computer hardware related problems efficiently and quickly in order to avoid any delay. Must know how to get maximum speed from the computer or server practically.
Must be very good in Hardware Troubleshooting as well.
Will be maintaining Vendor and Hardware stock Excel sheet.
If interested, please reply us back with your updated CV.
