Title: L3 SCOM Administrator
Description:
The role is essential to the organisation and will be seen as a technical expert within their field, this would result in significant involvement in project planning for future services as well as maintenance and upgrade planning for existing. As technical expert the role holder would be expected to provide technical expertise for all changes within the remit of their technology tower and be r for the stability within their technologies.
The role would be seen as the last line of support in relation to the technology area of expertise.
Responsibilities
Configuration of SCOM 2016 / 2019 and any future versions. Managing SCOM Environment end-to-end
SME specialism in technical functions providing support in the following areas: Monitoring of Windows and key infrastructure components such as Server Operating Systems, Active Directory, VMware, Citrix, Websites, Exchange and Critical applications and WAN etc. Where necessary support other monitoring systems, such as Solar Winds, RedGate, Splunk etc.
Responsible for supervision of activities carried out by the Event administrators
Shared responsibility of patch management and application deployment from SCCM
Mentoring support analysts and junior support staff in all aspects of their specialism, supporting the creation of knowledge articles and driving the opportunity to shift left.
Ensure Critical Success Factors(CSFs) and Key Performance Indicators(KPIs) as defined in the IT Event Management process are measured and reported
Ensure CSFs and KPIs are achieved and where exceptions are noted, drive Service Improvement Plans(SIP) as necessary
Fulfill incident, request, change and problem remediation against the agreed service levels. In addition to ensuring providing expertise for project delivery is considered.
Analyse, commission / decommission of services, changes, scheduled/planned maintenance activities to ensure impact on event management is minimal. Flag risks to the management as appropriate.
Maintain and manage standards for the Banks IT infrastructure and associated systems in line with industry best practice.
Qualifications
A Computer Science or equivalent technical degree or qualification (or 3 years + experience in a similar role) is essential.
At least one technical qualifications (Microsoft, Cisco, Citrix or VMWare) is essential
ITIL V3 foundation
Experience details
Overall experience of 9 - 12 years in IT infrastructure domain
3 - 5 years previous experience in a complex corporate IT infrastructure role is essential.
2 - 3 years previous experience of supporting the following is essential: Monitoring and configuration Systems (SCOM, SCCM and OPManager)
2 - 3 years of previous experience supporting other critical technologies is desirable: AV Protection, SQL Database systems and associated applications, Virtualization (VMware), Storage (HP Sans) and Support, IT Security (Websense, F5, Dell SecureWorks etc.) and Web Infrastructure
2 years previous experience working within a financial services organisation is essential
1 year relationship management experience with 3rd party providers
Knowledge Requirements
Excellent knowledge on implementation & maintenance of Microsoft System Center Operations Manager (SCOM) 2016, 2019.
Excellent knowledge on Create / Manage SCOM views, Dashboards and reports via integration of 3rd party tools.
Excellent knowledge on Microsoft (AD / Exchange) and associated services, VMWare, SQL and Citrix Environments is essential
Excellent knowledge on IT Infrastructure Monitoring systems & technology
Basic knowledge of Microsoft System Centre Orchestrator
Basic knowledge of Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager (SCCM), patching and application deployment
Basic knowledge of ServiceNow Administration
Previous knowledge of banking applications (mortgage quoting, savings and lending specific) is required.
Excellent knowledge on ITIL framework
Strong Communication Skill (Oral & Written)

Title: Network Administrator
Description:
ABOUT US
Altruista Health is seeking the right candidate to join our dynamic and growing technology company (US healthcare domain) as a Network Administrator.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Network Administrator maintains and adjusts the network as needed ensuring maximum uptime, through monitoring, auditing, and reviewing network performance and security.
THE ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage the implementation of IT strategy for the organization
Perform the maintenance and administration of computer networks and related computing environments including computer networking hardware, software, applications, and related configurations
Perform configuration backups and testing of backup restoration
Participate in disaster recovery testing and scenario planning. Ability to perform when needed in the event of a failure requiring restoration of services
Oversee the diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving of hardware, software, or other network and system problems, and replace defective components when necessary (Tier 2)
Responsible for planning, coordinating, and implementing network security measures to protect data, software, and hardware
Secure network by developing network access, monitoring, control, evaluation and maintaining documentation
Manage network performance to identify areas of opportunity for efficiency and growth
Perform other duties as assigned
Fully applies basic principles, theories, and concepts to job assignments. Exhibits technical and operational proficiency solving problems of moderate complexity. Contributes to the completion of projects and programs in the area of expertise. May interface with internal and/or external customers and provide guidance to entry level Developers.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
The Network Administrator is not a supervisory role.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field (Master’s Degree preferred)
4+ years of related work experience
Proven experience in a network administrator role
Information Technology experience working with LAN/WAN routing and switching, load balancing, and network support
Experience with VPN connectivity for an enterprise organization (site-to-site and remote client access)

COMPETENCIES
Sense of ownership and responsibility towards problems and solutions
Advanced problem-solving skills to identify and resolve complex issues in a timely manner
Hands-on experience in networking, routing and switching
Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies
Experience in the healthcare industry preferred
Working knowledge of TCP/IP, IPSEC, Syslog, HTTP(S), SSH, SCP, DHCP, DNS, RDP, LDAP, SMTP protocols is a must. Experience with source and destination NAT is also a must
Working knowledge of Wireless, VRRP, Netflow, Virtual IOS concepts, BGP and OSPF a plus
Ability to work independently – self-directed
Ability to manage Cisco networking devices (IOS knowledge)
Adequate knowledge in Visio, Word, Excel or equivalent tools
Ability to participate in on-call rotation - may include after-hours work
Understanding of network SNMP monitoring and use of configuration auditing and back up tools
Working knowledge of command-line driven configurations required
Attention to detail
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Tasks involve some physical effort, i.e. some standing and walking, or frequent light lifting (5-10 lb.); minimal dexterity in the use of fingers, limbs, or body in the operation of office equipment. Tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard and extended periods of sitting at a workstation or desk.
Tasks require:
Sound perception and discrimination
Visual perception and discrimination
Oral communications ability
The job may require occasional international travel.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The tasks will generally be performed in a typical office environment.
LOCATION/TRAVEL
Altruista Health is located in Hyderabad, IN.

Title: Technical Design Expert - ServiceNow CoE
Description:
Contribute to or support aspects of planning, design, development and delivery of system solutions for a specific business or technology area, in alignment with design and architectural standards and business requirements. Bring together, qualify and help prioritize new IT demand and ensure IT services provided to business are meeting service quality standards as per agreed SLAs.
Represent IT to the business or IT groups receiving services, ensuring that expectations for IT services are met. Identify and qualify new demand with overall responsibility for steering proposals through the early phases of approval; participate in establishment of budgets and investment proposals and acquire sponsorship and funding. Ensure the introduction of new / modified services happens in a planned, controlled and timely manner to minimize disruption and improve benefit. Build the detailed IT solution/service design, based on functional specifications and technical constraints. Develop, build, configure, customize and unit test solutions based on the functional and technical specifications to meet quality and performance requirements. Hold end to end accountability for business processes, integrate services horizontally across organization units, and manage interfaces between Service Delivery projects.
Guides, leadership, and oversight for design, and implementation of ServiceNow solutions including new applications, modules, integrations etc.
Supports in setting standards for the ServiceNow instance governance related to standard methodologies for defining configurations vs customizations, update set migration, cloning of environments, management of groups/users and data management
Partners with the Solution Design spocs to understand business requirements and provide guidance to the business on how to get the best value out of the ServiceNow platform.
Partners with applications and technology teams. Participates in team meetings, provides guidance, identifies architectural gaps and/or issues and represents the business domains interest in platform discussions.
Analyzes the current business and technology environments to detect deficiencies and recommends ServiceNow solutions for the improved uses of information technology.
Reviews all changes to the platform at a design level initially and then at the code level as part of the Change control process to ensure standards have been followed for development and any adverse impact for production move is avoided
Evaluates new features in the platform with ServiceNow releases and the suitability/applicability in the current environment. Lead all upgrade projects to ensure minimal impact to existing operations while enabling new features

Minimum requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or IT
Deep technical knowledge of ServiceNow including development experience
Experience of working with IT and business areas such as HR, Finance, Procurement etc
3+ years of customer interfacing experience – project oversight, customer presentation.
5+ years’ experience working with ServiceNow

Title: Sr Systems Admin Linux Patching
Description:
Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership
CCP Sr System Administrator

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?

The Enterprise Services Compute and Connectivity Platform Organization designs, implements and operates a state-of-the-art Information Systems Infrastructure serving around 110,000 employees, in over 900 locations across 65 plus countries. We work with the latest and emerging technologies to deliver scalable, high performing, always available infrastructure services around the world. We deliver services that connect, host, virtualize, store, collaborate, integrate, compute and transact business solutions that utilizes cloud first, automation, analytics, “as a Service”, BIG data and software defined.
The CCP Manage Sr System Administrator will be responsible for operational support of Windows Server Infrastructure, hardening and architecture for >15,000 servers at Honeywell. You will work in Windows & Linux Server Architecture & Administration (Windows 2019/2016/2012 Operating Systems & *NIX) This role includes application rationalization components to best assist business teams on migration, upgrades or decommissioning of legacy Infrastructure. This role will be responsible for installing and troubleshooting Windows based applications and assisting with Automation activities.

Key Responsibilities:

Operational support on a rotational basis of > 15,000 server
Accountable for technology roadmaps related to virtualization technologies, APIs, automation and cloud adoption
Work with Hyper Converged Infrastructure technology platforms like Nutanix, Dell VXRail, Dell VRTX, Dell Flex OS to create the strategy/direction for enterprise infrastructure
Troubleshoot performance issues related to virtualized workloads
Facilitate moving of workloads to/from on-prem cloud to off-prem cloud
Participate in calls with other members to address and troubleshoot application and or infrastructure related issues

YOU MUST HAVE
A bachelor’s Degree; preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or Business-Related Discipline
Experience in managing Windows & Linux operating systems
8 years of experience in operational support of enterprise server ecosystem
Experience with ServiceNow or another similar formal Service Management platform and/or methodology

Possess strong knowledge on Windows Server 2016/2012 OS
Strong knowledge of Server automation activities (CHEF, Powershell,or other)
Certification on Windows Server 2016/2012 Administration is a plus
DevOps experience is a plus
The ability to be a change agent and promote positive change in the organization
Excellent oral, written and collaborative communication skills, including executive level communications

The ability to partner effectively across IT teams, suppliers and business customers on cross-functional projects and process improvements
Windows patching tools like Ivanti & WSUS and Windows security standards & OS Hardening concepts are needed.
Strong interpersonal skills - effective listening and teaming
Self-motivated, demonstrated bias for action
Skilled in partnering with internal customers at all levels to define problems, identify solutions, and facilitate change
WE VALUE

Excellent leadership communication and executive presence
Strong influencing, program and change management skills
Strong business acumen and customer focus
Creation of resulted-oriented Management Operating System
Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision
Creative and collaborative problem-solving capability
Conveys specific, observable, and/or measurable expectations for each assignment, and verifies understanding and agreement on deliverables and timeframes
Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness
Attracting, motivating and developing diverse talent
Technical certifications in VMware or Hyperconverged space
The ability to partner effectively across IT teams, suppliers and business customers on cross-functional projects and process improvements
The ability to translate business issues / requirements and objectives into technical solutions
Strong knowledge of IT business processes and practices including ITIL methodology
Skill in partnering with internal customers at all levels to define problems, identify solutions, and facilitate change
Skill/proven ability to analyze complex problems and break them down into logical, actionable parts.
Experience with data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery options, configuration and execution
Strong interpersonal skills - effective listening and teaming
Self-motivated, demonstrated bias for action
The ability to be a change agent and promote positive change in the organization demonstrating drive for continual improvement and efficiency
Excellent oral, written and collaborative communication skills, including executive level communications

A bachelor’s Degree; preferably in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or Business-Related Discipline
YOU MUST HAVE
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or technical related field. 5 years experience in Windows Server Administration (Windows 2012/2008 Operating Systems). Experience supporting IT Operations.
WE VALUE
Experience in managing Windows File & Print Servers
5 years experience in managing Window Server & DC operations
Possess strong knowledge on Windows Server 2012/2008 OS
Strong knowledge on Windows Security & Patching tools
Certification on Windows Server 2012/2008 Administration
Knowledge in RCCA
Knowledge on FLEXLM based network license management tools.

Title: Lead Technical (Cloud) Instructor
Description:
We are looking for an extremely technical and personable person who is driven by helping others succeed. You are an excellent communicator and presenter.You have a great combination of consummate professionalism and the right personality to put folks at ease, whether teaching or managing curriculum development and deployment. You have the ability to take an extremely technical session and make it not only understandable, but fun and interesting.
The successful candidate is an experienced technical trainer, ideally with hands-on experience with Cloud Technologies and/or in-depth knowledge of software architecture and virtualization technologies.
In this role, you will deliver training content to developers, administrators, architects, and partners . You’ll have an opportunity to combine a passion for teaching, with enthusiasm for technology, to drive learning and establish positive customer relationships.
Experience
Min 10+ years of experience in programming, systems architecture or systems administration.
Qualification
Technical degree (i.e. Computer Science) or relevant work experience required.
Excellent oral presentation skills, interpersonal communication, and writing skills.
A strong “stage presence” and ability to manage a classroom of adult learners.
Experience architecting infrastructure solutions using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, network and storage architectures.
Recent coding experience in one or more of the following languages, Java, .Net, Perl, PHP, Ruby or Python.
Experience working within the Enterprise software market or Internet industries is highly desired.
Ability to travel as required.
Responsibilities
Deliver classroom and online training to customers and partners.
Assist in developing and maintaining training content, lab exercises, presentations, and accompanying materials.
Mentor internal and external authorized instructors as part of a train the trainer program.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge across the training community.
Understand the cloud market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.
Write to deepa.m@careerxperts.com to get connected!

6. Application Deployment, Data Ingestion, Data Storage & Data Access Authorization (Sqoop, PIG, Hive, HBase, etc.)

8. Ensuring Availability and Reliability of Data & Analytics Systems
9. Assistance on Cluster Upgrade and Versioning; best practices (Rolling & Express Upgrades)
10. Disaster Recovery: Associated Architecture; Data Replication; RTO/RPO
11. Need to work with Customer’s functional teams for Hadoop design best practices as required
Contribute to new Product validation, implementation & Knowledge Transfer (KT)

Profile Required
Role / Job Summary – Bigdata Hadoop Administrator (L2 Level)
Years of Experience – 6 Years (At least 4 years of relevant experience)
Qualification / Certification – HDP (Hortonworks) Certified Administrator is preferred

Mandatory Skills / Experience –
1. Strong Knowledge of Bigdata Architecture & Administrator's role
2. Expertise in installing Hadoop Cluster and its related components
3. Configuration and Performance Tuning of Hadoop Cluster
4. Manage, Maintain, Monitor and Troubleshoot Hadoop Clusters
5. Ganglia & Nagios Alerts Monitoring
6. Data Ingestion, Data Access & Data storage
7. Application Deployment and Disaster Recovery
8. Experience in Hadoop Upgrades
9. Cluster Connectivity, Security, Backup and Disaster Recovery
10. Good Scripting knowledge in UNIX Shell/ Perl
11. Excellent communication skills
12. Ability to work independently with a strong attention to detail
13. Ability to work well in a global team environment
Good to have skills / Experience –
1. Working knowledge of Python & Ansible
2. Knowledge on Automation Tools

Societe Generale is one of the leading European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial strength and proven expertise in innovation with a strategy of sustainable growth, aiming to be the trusted partner for its clients, committed to the positive transformations of society and the economy

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status
Business Insight
A 100% owned subsidiary of European banking and financial services major Societe Generale (SG), Societe Generale Global Solution Centre (SG GSC) came into existence in 2000. Established as an offshore development centre in Bangalore, also having a presence in Chennai, SG GSC has 15 years of sustainable delivery expertise to its credit, and develops global best practices to promote the strategic objectives of the Societe Generale Group.
SG GSC possesses in-depth understanding of the business processes and cutting-edge technologies across domains of Societe Generale’s diverse portfolio. We deliver best-in-class solutions to the Group’s entities in the realm of corporate and investment banking, retail banking, specialized financing and insurance, private banking, and global investment management and services.
We place the highest importance on our employees and provide extensive opportunities for career progression and development. Title: IT Security Analyst Senior - PKI/Crypto- Certificate Managem...
Description:
Position Type :
Full time
Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
Education Desired :
Bachelor of Computer Science
Travel Percentage :
0%
Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.

About the team
It’s an amazing opportunity to join a Talented team of innovative and committed folks doing interesting work at the world’s largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions!
What you will be doing
IT Security Analyst Sr, will work closely with the Cyber Security Engineer and Cyber Security Analyst in managing the Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) environment.
The primary responsibility will be to work with a team of Analyst to monitor Digital Certificates to ensure they are issued when requested and renewed prior to their expiration date.
Assist with the management of soon to expire certificate queue
Assist with Certificate Vulnerability remediation project
Identification & Remediation of certificate vulnerabilities
Working with LOBs
Analyze IAM / PKI technology industry and market trends, assess the impact of emerging security threats on the enterprise risk level, recommends technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate in the business plans
Assist with design of new PKI infrastructure including but not limited to:
CPS, DR plans, HSM integrations, Monitoring plans, Audit plans, etc
Work closely with server teams to stabilize current PKI infrastructure
Work with PKI Engineering, Cyber Security, and Application Support teams in obtaining data from specific source repositories (e.g. Venafi, Qualys, Nexpose, ServiceNow) used to determine ownership of a host or piece of equipment where a cert has been discovered from a scan or agents
Work with Developers, Systems Administrators, Middleware Administrators, Software Engineers, Application owners, and executives to validate certificate(s) application, server, location, IP address, etc. and advise them on certificate expiration inventories
Escalate urgent pending PKI certificate expirations to senior PKI engineers, Application Support, and Cyber Security executives for priority remediation
Assist with onboarding various teams and importing certificates
Assist users with basic certificate creation issues
Add groups/users, manage permissions, remove groups/users
Create, cut, and deploy certificates when necessary via legacy portals or via Venafi
Make recommendations to improve maturity of existing tools and capabilities improve protection.
Meet with customers to identify and analyze requirements, risks, business processes, existing technologies, etc
Provide excellent service to every internal/external client that utilizes PKI
Other related duties assigned as needed.
.
What you bring:
Knowledge of information storing systems (Confluence, SharePoint)
Understanding of Change Management Processes
Basic understating of Data Protection topics and Cryptography.
5+yrs of experience with certificate management
Experience with Venafi
Experience with creating, cutting, and deploying certificates
Basic certificate security standard understanding
Basic understanding of IPv4 and IPv6
Knowledge of Agile and JIRA desirable
Knowledge of security technologies (encryption, data protection, design, privilege access, etc.
Proficiency in time management, communications, decision making, presentation and organizational skills
Proficiency in planning, reporting, establishing goals and objectives, standards, priorities and schedules
Basic to intermediate decision-making and problem solving skills
Basic to intermediate verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization
Experience establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with employees and/or clients
Added Bonus (If Any)
Basic Venafi experience (preferred)

What we offer you:
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
A competitive salary and benefits
A variety of career development tools, resources and opportunities

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Title: Office Administrator
Description:
Hyderabad


How To Apply
To learn more about this career defining role, contact Swathi To, HR-Generalist at info@isystems.mobi or at
+91 9581817878.



Integrated Precision Systems and Services (IPSS) is an ISO 9001:2015 certified company established in 2011 with a vision to promote the utilization of innovative and traditional approaches in various fields of knowledge to offer integrated and sustainable solutions. IPSS is dedicated to provide end to end solutions to its valuable and perspective clients globally as per the requirements and achieve 100% customer satisfaction on acceptance of deliverables.

In a constantly changing technology landscape, we have initiated an organisation wide transformation,which aims to put IPSS in a position to better serve the Industry over the next 10 years. As part of this transformation, we are trying to find a better balance across people, processes, Infrastructure and resources.

IPSS is one of the fastest growing end-to-end Environmental Quality Management, Mobile Systems, Precision Agriculture, Graphic Design, Software Development, R&D solution providers headquartered in Hyderabad, India. With a passion to utilise the information of the dynamic world for greater advantage, IPSS partners with clients to create a transparent, value- based relationship for total customer satisfaction.

Our Project Portfolio encompasses Environmental Quality Management, Mobile Systems, Precision Agriculture, Graphic Design, Software Development, R&D Services.

If you would like to be part of our transformation, IPSS is looking forward to having you in our collaborative project team which promotes innovation, personal growth, with an emphasis on accountability and a people centric approach.

If you are ready for an opportunity to make an impact, earn a competitive compensation combined with a comprehensive benefits on par with industry standards (Sick, Casual Leaves) while still having a work-life balance.

Reporting to Manager and Management Representative, the Office Administrator is responsible for delivering the highest level of customer service to clients, fellow employees and customers through the coordination and administration.

The desired candidate will have a similar background of experience in handling, incoming calls and provide quality service by responding to the requests promptly, efficiently and courteously.
The successful candidate will have an
Professional appearance, demeanour with a positive flare and strong customer service attitude.
Experience to organize, multi-task, prioritize while being resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES
As a Office Administrator at IPSS, You will be the first point of contact for customers, Clients and Employees. You will contribute towards shaping their impression of IPSS and own their first experience with us. You will also drive day to day administrative responsibilities enabling our members to experience a seamless working environment, free of all maintenance issues
Handle all incoming and outgoing calls.
Greet visitors warmly and make sure they are comfortable.
Responsible for maintaining records of people moving in and out of the organisation.
Owner of maintaining all office supplies like Stationery, Communication Devices etc.
Receive,redirect and maintain all incoming correspondence, including couriers, vendors, bills etc.
Retrieve, communicate and update all the invoice details every month.
Supervise Housekeeping operations with in the organisation.

Education and Experience:
Any bachelor's degree/ Diploma.
At least 1 year Experience is required.

Superior interpersonal and listening skills – pleasant, approachable, and patient. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Punctual and reliable. Should be well Organized and detail oriented. Able to work on MS Office/ Google Suite Products. Perform operational activities. Handle all incoming calls. Learn and comply with established policies, standards and procedures with in the organisation. Provides excellent customer service. Controls cash, cheques, etc. with in the Organisation.

Title: Salesforce Administrator
Description:
Summary of position:
The Salesforce Administrator will lead the ongoing development of our Salesforce deployment. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption using the Force.com platform. The administrator will work closely with functional leaders and subject matter experts to identify develop and deploy new business processes including: Marketing, Outreach and our core program business processes. This role is part project manager, part administrator and part Salesforce analyst. The Salesforce Administrator will be responsible for executing on a day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and improvement of our CRM platform.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:
Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce.com environment
Handle all basic administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine tasks
Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for upgrades
Manage Salesforce.com data feeds and other integrations
Effectively act as the liaison between our users, vendors and the application development teams
Work independently with members of the user community to define and document development requirements
Skills Required:
Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards
Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes
Experience Required:
Minimum three years of experience as a Salesforce.com administrator
Saleforce.com Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certified
Sales Cloud and Developer certifications preferred
Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, process builder, workflows, data loader, and other content of intermediate complexity
Experience working with AppExchange products such as Docusign and Conga
Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
Strong data management abilities
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
Experience with nonprofit processes preferred
Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred

Title: Senior Linux Administrator
Description:
(Location - Surat, Gujarat)
Interested candidates can send resumes to contact@spchuf.com

We are looking for a highly qualified and experienced Sr. Linux System Administrator to provide support for OTT, IPTV, Live Video Streaming & VoD Services running on Ubuntu servers using Wowza Streaming Engine and other streaming technologies.

Responsibilities:

Monitor and manage pools of Ubuntu servers delivering CDN and video services from multiple data centers around the world
Monitoring and manage internal and external networks
Help define and validate system configurations for high availability
Handle day-to-day problems and service requests related to OS, Server and Public/Private clouds
Perform Root Cause Analysis, continuous improvements and documentation.
Perform capacity management of help develop scaling strategy of physical and virtual servers
Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans for the servers and CDN infrastructure
Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation and maintenance windows
Complete appropriate validation paperwork as required with minimal deviations or discrepancies
Requirements:

5+ yrs of experience as Linux System Administrator, with 2 of 3 last years as Sr Ubuntu System Administrator Certified in LPIC-1 or LPIC-2
Expert at configuring, managing and monitoring Ubuntu servers
Advanced knowledge of Linux shell scripting and command line tools
Excellent English speaking and writing skills
Desired Profile:

Bachelors Degree or higher in any Discipline University
Strong knowledge of Networking protocols, equipment, and tools such as TCP and UDP configuration, tuning and troubleshooting DNS Management and troubleshooting Monitoring and reporting tools such as Nagios, Whatsup, MTRG/PRTG
Deep experience configuring, managing and upgrading Ubuntu servers
Advanced configuration and monitoring of web services based on Apache, nginx, Java, Node.js and others
Experience configuring and managing Wowza servers and services
Familiarity with public cloud infrastructure such as AWS and experience managing a hybrid environment
Willingness to work in flexible timings including night shift (24/7)
Pluses:

Experience with hardware encoders/transcoders like Harmonic, Elemental, Telairity, Matrox, DVEO, etc.
Experience with software encoders/transcoders like ffmpeg/libav, FMLE, Wirecast, Wowza, VLC etc.
Experience with CDN Networks like Akamai, Level3, Edgecast, Amazon CloudFront etc.
Knowledge of Streaming Protocols HLS, MPEG-DASH, RTMP, RTSP/RTP
Knowledge of Video/Audio Codecs like H.264, HEVC, VC1, AAC, MP3 and others
Programming skills in one or more languages like C, C++, Perl, Python, PHP, JavaScript, etc.

Title: PMO Analyst
Description:
Mitratech is a proven global technology partner for corporate legal and compliance teams. Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed. The professionals who are thriving at Mitratech are people like you who know how to balance individual excellence with teamwork. We believe our employees' enthusiasm fuels great work, so we pursue individuals with a passion for building an environment of ownership, transparency, continuous improvement as well as a dedication to driving the best possible experience for our clients. In other words, if you like people and technology, you'll fit right in.
Job Overview :
The PSO Analyst will assist with the administration of the Professional Services Operations function within Mitratech's Professional Services organization. The purpose of the role is to assist in administrating our Professional Services Automation (PSA) tool, OpenAir, maintain the quality of the data being entered into it, and reporting on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The PSO Analyst will also help support the professional services team, document processes, and help drive continual improvement.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Help configure and maintain the system
Identify opportunities to help improve the end user experience
Coordinate with Project Managers to establish a time sheet entry cadence and track hours weekly
Assist in creating and documenting department processes including flowcharts, standard operating procedures, reports, and other documents
Prepare periodic KPI Reporting and perform associated analytics
Produce dashboards, charts and reports using BI software and MS Excel
Coordinate and schedule PSO team meetings such as monthly team meetings, project status reviews, project reviews, lessons learned meetings, training and on boarding.
Conduct elements of the on boarding process for new employees including assisting with PSA training
Perform ad hoc portfolio reporting and analysis
Maintain the department calendar
Maintain the PSO SharePoint site

Requirements & Skills:
2+ years working in a Project Management Office and/or as a PSA administrator
Prior Experience with PSA tool configuration,use and support,or similar software background
Prior experience with project accounting/project controls or similar analytical role
Organizational Change Management
Project Financials
Risk Management
Project Planning and Control
Data Quality Management
Strong experience in Open Air by Net suite or similar PSA Software,Advanced Excel Skills,MS Office,SharePoint and Salesforce
Business Intelligence software (Power BI, Si Sense, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral)

Education:
M.Com/CA/ICWAI/MBA Finance

All applicants meeting minimum qualifications will be required to complete a 30 minute online assessment as part of your candidate application.
We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to manage organization of key client projects.

Title: Mainframe Storage Specialist
Description:
Introduction
System Administrators are the gatekeepers to the many systems that run our company and our clients. As a System Admin with IBM, you will have the opportunity to provide high-value IT services and leverage our leading-edge technology portfolio in our global network. Your work has a direct impact on the day-to-day productivity of our business by ensuring integrity of, and access to, our most important resource: data.

Your Role and Responsibilities
You and IBM India
IBM's Purpose is to be essential to our clients, to the world and one another and we are confident that together as IBMers we will drive this purpose. When you join IBM you join a culture of openness, teamwork, trust, and the invitation and expectation to have a voice. Join us and Do your Best Work Ever.
We are recognized gold standard for inclusion, reflected in winning, to name a few, the 2018 Catalyst Award for advancing women in business, the National Award 'Best Employer of People with Disabilities' and being named one of the top 5 2018 Top Companies for Women Technologists for building an inclusive workplace — We advocate for fairness and equality as everyone is, and always has been, welcome at IBM.
Join a brand with a history of continuous re-invention, transforming itself throughout its 100-plus years. In the past five decades alone, IBM has ushered in the eras of the mainframe, the personal computer, IT services and enterprise software. In its current transformation, IBM is once again leading the reordering of the technology industry.
Business Unit Introduction
Our IBM Global Technology Services (GTS) helps clients plan, implement and lead an efficient, resilient, flexible IT infrastructure. Be it groundbreaking outsourcing tied to business outcomes or integrated managed services or discrete services - IBM GTS is the partner of choice for infrastructure services.
Come join our team of IBM experts, who are leaders with vision, distinguished engineers and IT architects who have worked with thousands of clients to transform enterprise IT, migrate to cloud, apply automation and ensure business continuity. We help client run their IT better, accelerate innovation and deliver unmatched performance with the power automation.
Who you are
As Mainframe Storage Specialist, you are responsible to provide technical support with high degree of Customer Happiness by meeting Service Level Agreements (SLA) and process compliance. You will perform business impact analysis and risk assessments to reduce the likelihood of significant service outage or disasters.
If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.
What will you do
Adopt the given technology to meet the drift of customer and business requirements
Storage box data migration (DASD to DASD and Tape to tape) and Storage replication
Analyze and research options for collaborates with exiting external systems
Root Cause Analysis preparation and meeting Service level agreement for submission
Develop, document and maintain procedures for system utilities such as backup/restore, performance tuning and configuration of environments as well as incremental backups as required
Initialize / add new DASD volumes and Add new tape volumes. Perform the space management activities such as VTOC resizing, Defrag, Compress/Reclaim/Release/Cleaning of datasets
Manage and Define SMS rules and ACS routines along with reorganization of storage dataset (RMM/HSM CDS & Catalog file)
Disaster recovery planning and performing the recovery test (Tape recovery / DASD Replication / Tape Replication) and Managing the Copy services / GDPS
Problem determination and resolution within expected time frame
Assume personal responsibility for resolving problems in most effective way possible within SLA reaching root cause and preventing problems
Lead daily Operations meetings provided there are no P1 incidents running
Aid with identifying problem management trends
You and IBM India
IBM's Purpose is to be essential to our clients, to the world and one another and we are confident that together as IBMers we will drive this purpose. When you join IBM you join a culture of openness, teamwork, trust, and the invitation and expectation to have a voice. Join us and Do your Best Work Ever.
We are recognized gold standard for inclusion, reflected in winning, to name a few, the 2018 Catalyst Award for advancing women in business, the National Award 'Best Employer of People with Disabilities' and being named one of the top 5 2018 Top Companies for Women Technologists for building an inclusive workplace — We advocate for fairness and equality as everyone is, and always has been, welcome at IBM.
Join a brand with a history of continuous re-invention, transforming itself throughout its 100-plus years. In the past five decades alone, IBM has ushered in the eras of the mainframe, the personal computer, IT services and enterprise software. In its current transformation, IBM is once again leading the reordering of the technology industry.
Business Unit Introduction
Our IBM Global Technology Services (GTS) helps clients plan, implement and lead an efficient, resilient, flexible IT infrastructure. Be it groundbreaking outsourcing tied to business outcomes or integrated managed services or discrete services - IBM GTS is the partner of choice for infrastructure services.
Come join our team of IBM experts, who are leaders with vision, distinguished engineers and IT architects who have worked with thousands of clients to transform enterprise IT, migrate to cloud, apply automation and ensure business continuity. We help client run their IT better, accelerate innovation and deliver unmatched performance with the power automation.
Who you are
As Mainframe Storage Specialist, you are responsible to provide technical support with high degree of Customer Happiness by meeting Service Level Agreements (SLA) and process compliance. You will perform business impact analysis and risk assessments to reduce the likelihood of significant service outage or disasters.
If you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative workplace, IBM provides an environment where you will be challenged and inspired every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here.
What will you do
Adopt the given technology to meet the drift of customer and business requirements
Storage box data migration (DASD to DASD and Tape to tape) and Storage replication
Analyze and research options for collaborates with exiting external systems
Root Cause Analysis preparation and meeting Service level agreement for submission
Develop, document and maintain procedures for system utilities such as backup/restore, performance tuning and configuration of environments as well as incremental backups as required
Initialize / add new DASD volumes and Add new tape volumes. Perform the space management activities such as VTOC resizing, Defrag, Compress/Reclaim/Release/Cleaning of datasets
Manage and Define SMS rules and ACS routines along with reorganization of storage dataset (RMM/HSM CDS & Catalog file)
Disaster recovery planning and performing the recovery test (Tape recovery / DASD Replication / Tape Replication) and Managing the Copy services / GDPS
Problem determination and resolution within expected time frame
Assume personal responsibility for resolving problems in most effective way possible within SLA reaching root cause and preventing problems
Lead daily Operations meetings provided there are no P1 incidents running
Aid with identifying problem management trends

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Minimum 7+ years of experience in Mainframe Storage Administration environment with work management, user management, journal management and performance management
Proven knowledge on tune performance and ensure high availability of infrastructure
Expertise in Storage hardware subsystems including IBM DASD (DS8K), IBM Automated tape library and IBM Virtual tape library (TS7700/TS7720/TS7740/TS7760)
Proficient in technologies like P2V, V2V and P2P migrations
Experience in EMC’s storage (VMAX and DLM) and Replication (SRDF) technologies
Recognize complex problems related to functional objectives. Analyze situations and implement solutions, or develop new system elements, procedures or processes and proven experience on BRMS, Tape management, ATL/VTL for Tape Libraries
Validated expertise on third party tools like Robot/TATTOOL

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Proficient in working with high availability environment along with alignment to process (ITIL)
You love collaborative environments that use agile methodologies to encourage creative design thinking and find innovative ways to develop with cutting edge technologies
Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals and with creative approach to work
Intuitive individual with an ability to manage change and proven time management
Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

About Business Unit
At Global Technology Services (GTS), we help our clients envision the future by offering end-to-end IT and technology support services, supported by an unmatched global delivery network. It's a unique blend of bold new ideas and client-first thinking. If you can restlessly reinvent yourself and solve problems in new ways, work on both technology and business projects, and ask, "What else is possible?" GTS is the place for you!

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Intern, Technology (Data Management)
Description:
The Intern, Technology (Data Management) is responsible for supporting our data management systems at Teach For India. This person will be responsible for understanding and documenting business software requirements, supporting and training end-users on data management processes and developing visual dashboards and reports on top of the same to enable efficient data-driven decision making for stakeholders across the organization.
Team Overview
The Technology team is responsible for providing strategic direction to technology implementations, software solutions and hardware support for all the verticals of Teach For India. We’re a small but strong team that aims to use science and art to create wonder. "Gandhi meets Jobs" is our motto and we work towards creating beautiful apps that empower all our stakeholders on their journey towards our collective vision. We operate with the agility and rigour of a startup, making use of the best and latest technologies available. Some of the technologies/platforms we currently use are Salesforce.com, ReactJS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Elastic, Neo4j and we adopt new technologies when/where we believe they add value. We're not rigid about using any specific technology. However, we're committed to providing an amazing user experience on every product/solution that we build.
Responsibilities
Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Provide support to internal stakeholder teams in maintaining data on existing systems and creating reports and dashboards.
Document business requirements and test cases for a new system implementation
Test out the new system and processes before release to the stakeholder team
Service data management requests such as but not limited to bulk upload/download, verification/validation, extraction, transformation, loading of data.
Run completion and accuracy reports and share the same with internal stakeholders.
Education and Experience
Graduate/Post-graduate degree in technology or information systems or prior internship/work experience in this domain.
Minimum Qualifications, Skills and Competencies
Proficient in building reports and presenting findings.
Experience in the use of Excel and/or any scripting tools for data transformation and aggregation.
Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau/Power BI/Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience in writing functional requirements documents, test case documents.
Preferred Qualifications, Skills and Competencies
Salesforce Administrator/Developer certification/working experience.
Knowledge of data warehousing, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Knowledge of ETL frameworks/libraries/tools.

Title: Splunk
Description:
Job Description
About Accenture: Accenture Technology powers our clients’ businesses with innovative technologies—established and emerging—changing the way their people and customers experience work, life and entertainment. Join Accenture Technology and you’ll translate the operational needs of the world’s governments and leading businesses into the innovative technical solutions that will enable them to better serve their customers—your friends, family and neighbors.You’ll deliver everything from point solutions for a single business function to large, long-term outsourcing services, to complex systems integration installations spanning multiple businesses and functions. You’ll create custom-designed solutions or integrate our technology platforms with their operations.

Title: Senior Manager, IT
Description:
Connecting the world to wellness
MINDBODY emerged from the simple idea that small business owners deserve the time to focus on what matters most: their customers. Our software has transformed that vision into the world's leading wellness services marketplace, linking hundreds of thousands of passionate health, wellness and beauty professionals to the millions of clients they serve.
MINDBODY is a cloud-based business management software company for the wellness services industry.
We serve about 35 million consumers located in 130 countries & territories.
At MINDBODY, work-life balance takes on a new meaning for us. When your life goals & values align with the work you do every day, balance is second nature.
We help inspired business owners seamlessly succeed & individuals all over the globe lead healthier, happier lives with our technology.

Company Overview - https://company.mindbodyonline.com/
Follow our careers page here - https://mindbodyonline.com/careers
JOB SUMMARY –
MINDBODY’s Corporate Information Technology organization is seeking an experienced Senior Manager, IT to establish and head up its Pune, India location. This is a full-time management position that will report into the Sr. VP, IT in the US and will be part of the IT leadership team. The Senior Manager, IT will be responsible for several technical IT disciplines that support Mindbody globally. Those disciplines include: Business Systems, Integration, IT Operations and Support. The Senior Manager will be the IT site leader in Pune and will partner other IT and business teams to help deliver innovative technology and business solutions. You must possess a broad background in information technology, a practical understanding of how businesses work, as well excellent problem-solving, analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with IT peers in the US to define requirements for the team in Pune. Identify talent, recruit, and develop the local IT Team.
Provide mentorship to the team, identify development opportunities and assist with training plans.
Manage technical staff on business processes, including risk, security and team processes.
Act as the senior technical advisor for the team, providing systems and design guidance or direct implementation when required.
Provide technical direction and oversight for the IT Engineers; Business Systems Analysts, Administrators and Developers; and IT Technicians in Mindbody’s Corporate technology environment on a day-to-day basis - coordinating technical design, ensuring adherence to our release and change management process and maintaining the production environment.
Coordinate with the IT PMO on project technical design and delivery for associated projects
Follow and implement industry best practices for release & environment management.
Should be self-driven, good communicator and a team player.
Partner with the various departments to define and document process, strive for operational excellence and translate business problems to solutions.
Manage multiple small to medium-scope projects, including requirements gathering, developing work breakdowns and project plans, track task status, and escalate as needed to keep projects on schedule
Define and document processes, capture functional requirements, assess technology solutions, generate use cases, create functional designs, document training plans, analyze data migration needs
Analyze long term requirements and make recommendations and proposals for implementing technology strategies
Quickly learn new technologies, find creative solutions to a wide variety of problems, and communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences
All other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of experience in IT information technology
10+ years of overall IT experience.
5+ years of experience managing a team to deliver complex technology projects
Deep knowledge of the Microsoft stack, including Active Directory, Windows Server and O365
Experience in managing Salesforce, Netsuite and Aria systems, or similar Tier 1 centrally administered enterprise systems
Knowledge Level ITIL v3 or above certification
Experience using ServiceNow to manage your team’s work and metrics, or similar service management tool
Experience with Agile processes
Deep understanding of collaboration enabling principles and methodologies
Experience with ITSM and SDLC methodologies
Experience creating and monitoring KPI’s and Metrics
Excellent understanding of IT business processes
Excellent oral and written documentation skills
Experience with business process analysis

SCOPE OF SUPERVISION/AUTHORITY:
Duties are performed under limited supervision.
Decision making authority is broad within the scope of assignments.
This position requires self-direction and continuous evaluation of priorities to ensure completion by deadlines.
All decisions and consulting will reflect adherence with internal policies and state and federal law.
This position plays a key role in recruiting, supervising, evaluating, mentoring and if necessary, dismissing team members.
WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
You will need dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard
This position is mostly stationary and will be required to remain stationary for extended periods of time

Title: Customer Success Manager, Universities
Description:
Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where 64 million learners from around the world come to learn skills of the future. More than 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs. 2,500 companies trust the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera for Campus empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.

We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to manage Coursera’s University customers. Universities are increasingly turning to Coursera to power on-campus learning with Coursera’s course and product offerings. In this important role, you will be part of a small-yet-high-powered team that is tasked with building out Coursera’s “Coursera-for-Campus” strategy. As part of the Customer Success team, you will manage a portfolio largely comprised of university customers. Your performance will depend on your ability to balance account renewal, growth and customer satisfaction. In this cross-functional role, you can expect to work with members within Sales, Implementation, Partnerships, Marketing, Product, Finance and Legal.
Your Responsibilities:
Own strategic relationships with Coursera’s university customers using Coursera to drive on-campus learning
Help launch Coursera on university campuses, drive adoption by developing learner engagement programs, curate course content to match university needs
Own end-to-end renewal process for all university customers by developing account plans, holding executive business reviews, and negotiating contracts
Consult and work closely with University management to develop a strategy for embedding Coursera into the pedagogy
Be part of the core team that builds Coursera’s strategy for how Coursera can help drive on-campus education for universities across the globe
Collect product feedback and influence the product roadmap and GTM strategy
Travel to meet top customers (usually once every 1-2 months)
Your Skills:
8+ years of work experience in managing senior customer relationships
Strong background in account management, contract negotiation, customer success
Understanding of the Higher Education system in India with respect to curriculum, credit transfers and disciplines
Experience driving product adoption within large educational or enterprise populations
Natural problem solver and strategic thinker, comfortable manipulating large data-sets
Executive presence, ability to work with senior university administrators and faculty
Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments
Passion for education, education reform, and interest in working for a social enterprise
Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

Title: Microsoft Exchange Administrator
Description:
Founded in 1987 and listed on NASDAQ, our client is headquartered in the USA and has an annual turnover of over USD 2+ Billion. They are a leading provider of technology solutions for small, medium, enterprises throughout the North America, Europe and Asia. Their comprehensive expertise and proven experience in advanced technologies and consulting & implementation services makes them the preferred partner for many global MNC customers.

The company is looking for experienced Microsoft Exchange Engineers for their offshore development center in Gurgaon. Primary responsibilities will consist of the operation, maintenance and troubleshooting of a Microsoft Exchange 2013/2010 enterprise environment that consists of multiple Exchange orgs. Additional responsibilities include supporting the larger messaging environment (relays/gateways/etc.) as well as end user device issues (outlook/mobile). The candidate will provide systems administration responsibilities across a wide array of technical services while working in a global team setting.
Job Functions:
Provide Microsoft Exchange email system support.
Support and maintain Exchange 2013/2010.
Provide Microsoft Windows Server operating system support.
Create and manage users/groups in Active Directory.
Monitor server performance and availability.
Address operational systems issues including file and share permissions, user accounts and installing applications.
Upgrade and replace server hardware where appropriate.
Minimum Experience:
6+ years of IT experience
4+ years of Microsoft Exchange experience
Good technical knowledge on MS operating system (Windows 2008R2, 2012, 2012R2, and 2016)
Administration and support on-premises Microsoft Active Directory
Administration and support on-premises Microsoft Exchange 2013/2010 infrastructure
Experience with creating, managing, and maintaining Exchange DAGs
Experience upgrading Microsoft Exchange servers
Extensive knowledge of end user support issues in relationship to Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013, Outlook and Mailbox management and support
Experience working with relay servers and email gateway servers
Experienced with PowerShell specifically for reporting, monitoring, and large scale tasks
Candidate must be able to effectively communicate in English (written & verbal)
Additional Experience
Experience with multiple large scale cross forest Exchange migrations
Extensive Active Directory management experience including Group Policy management
Veritas Enterprise Vault experience is a plus
Cisco IronPort experience is a plus
Skype for BusinessLync experience is a plus
Experience with Hybrid ExchangeExchange OnlineOffice 365 is a plus
Experience with Azure AD is a plus
Experience with Azure AD Connect is a plus
Experience with Microsoft PKI infrastructure is a plus

Job Location: Gurgaon, Delhi NCR

Compensation: Best in the industry

Job Type: Permanent role on company's payroll

Title: HRIS Successfactors Admin
Description:
The SuccessFactors System Administrator is responsible for helping our internal customers leverage SuccessFactors value. This position is responsible to support system configuration, maintenance and ongoing administration of their SuccessFactors application. This position will support a variety of modules which may include Performance and Goal Management, Career Development Planning, Succession, Onboarding, Recruiting, Compensation, Learning, and Employee Central
In This Role You Will:
Provide support and guidance of all implemented SuccessFactors modules (including PM, GM, ONB, Recruiting , CDP, Comp, LMS, EC) Administrator support includes (but not limited to)
Serve as System Administrator for various SuccessFactors modules. Support live systems by troubleshooting and resolving issues.
Respond to internal customers for system admin related issues
Troubleshoot and resolve problems related to upgrades, releases, fixes and enhancements
Maintain system security roles, launch forms and manage supporting content (ex. Profiles, forms, updates to notifications, templates, pick lists, settings, field labels, etc.)
Configure and update system setup using Admin Center
Participate in regularly scheduled meetings – provide updates, recommendations and general problem-solving ideas.
Create ad hoc reports, tiles and dashboards
Evaluate SuccessFactors quarterly releases for system impacts and provide/inform our clients of updates and recommendations
Assist with updating and maintaining configuration workbooks, training materials and other system related documentation
Assist with various phases of system testing
Qualifications Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Management, Computers, or Technology
4-9+ years of progressive experience with SuccessFactors system administration in multiple modules SAP Associate Certification is a plus (Performance Management, Goal Management, Career Development Planning, Succession, Onboarding, Recruiting Management, Employee Central, Workforce Analytics, Learning and/or Compensation).
3-5+ years of HR experience providing knowledge of general HR processes and human capital topics
Basic Knowledge of web technology including HTML, XML, browsers, etc. required
Advanced proficiency using the Microsoft Office Suite of applications, i.e. Excel advanced functions. In-depth experience with Excel including pivot tables, lookups, graphing and charting functionality
Knowledgeable in current and possible future policies, practices, trends, technology, and information affecting the organization and able to make recommendations on how best to leverage SuccessFactors
Focus on attention to details and deadlines with a high commitment to accuracy on a consistent basis.
Self-starter with self-confidence, enthusiasm, and strong customer service orientation with an emphasis on creativity and diligence
Exhibits personal drive and professional motivation; is able to work individually but also on a team
Strong communication skills reflecting logic and clarity in thought process, with sufficient level of detail based on audience and content
Acts with customers in mind and is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal customers
Demonstrated agility in day-to-day work, multi-tasking and working under time constraints.
Adept at making informed decisions in a timely manner
Excellent documentation skills (procedure manuals, workbook updates, creating support tickets, etc.)
Experience working with a ticketing/case management system is a plus
The ability to design, prepare, and deliver information in a manner that is consistent with the requirements of the SOP

Title: Salesforce Administrator
Description:
OakNorth is the next-generation credit and monitoring platform that provides banks and lending institutions with the insight and foresight needed to create a better borrowing experience for the Missing Middle – the growth business who are the backbones of communities and economies globally but who have been in banking’s blind spot for decades.
The business was founded in 2015 by Rishi Khosla and Joel Perlman, who previously co-founded Copal Amba and grew it to 3,000 employees over 12 years, before selling it to Moody’s (NYSE: MCO) in 2014, returning 125 times capital to seed investors.
Since its inception, OakNorth has secured over $1bn from several investors, including: Clermont Group, Coltrane, EDBI of Singapore, GIC, Indiabulls, NIBC, Toscafund, and SoftBank’s Vision Fund.
The Platform has been deployed at various banks across North America, Europe, and Asia, and in the UK where OakNorth lends off of its own balance sheet via OakNorth Bank. The platform has helped OakNorth Bank become the fastest-growing business in Europe according to the Financial Times FT 1000 (2020), profitably lending over £4bn to date. In terms of the impact this has had on the economy, OakNorth Bank’s loans have directly helped with the creation of 13,000 new homes and 17,000 new jobs in the UK, as well as adding several billion pounds to the economy.
With offices in London, New York, Manchester, Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Istanbul, Gurgaon and Bangalore, the global team across the OakNorth Holdings group is over 800 people.

Job Responsibility:

Design and maintain the data model, user interface and custom applications
Maintain System, Security and Integrity: Grant/ remove and maintain user licenses, maintain security including sharing rules and security levels. Design, Create and maintain user roles, profiles and hierarchies.
Specializes in deployments via Changesets, ANT deployments. Experience on CICD (Continuous integration and Continuous Delivery) using SFDX, Jenkins
Well versed with usage of version control systems like GitHub/Bitbucket.
Managing multiple Salesforce environments in multi-vendor environment.
Design reports, dashboards, and business process automation by means of configuration/ point-and-click tools available in Salesforce. Strong reporting background using standard reporting tools including standard salesforce.com reporting functionality
Data Migration using Apex Data Loader or tools like Jitterbit- experience in performing mass uploads and updates of data as required
Ensure data integrity by merging duplicate Leads, Contacts, and Accounts and removing unnecessary fields and data.
Monitor orphan records and cleanup as per Org policy
Monitor application storage usage and data backup as needed.
User Assistance, Training, Adoption and Satisfaction
Manage applications for mobile use
Nice to have exposure on tools like Autorabit.

Desired Skills:
3 to 5 years of Salesforce administration experience
Salesforce.com Administrator certification is required
Thank you very much for your interest in OakNorth. We are happy to consider you for roles within our group of companies. If we can identify a match between your skill set and our immediate recruiting needs, please expect to hear from us very soon. If we are unable to identify a fit in the near term, please note that we intend to retain the data you send to us so we may contact you in the future.

Should have good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols(DNS, TCP/IP, DHCP, HTTPS, etc.)

Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experience

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Customer service experience / strong customer focus

Good understanding of distributed computing environments

Strong multi-tasking skills

Self-starter who is excited about learning new technology

Databases (MySQL, Oracle, NoSQL)

Open to working non-standard hours (no night shifts) including a Sun-Mon or Fri-Sat weekend.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Amazon has built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, #1 most trusted, and #2 most innovative. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in Cloud technologies. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology assisting a global list of companies that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. You will work with leading companies in this space and directly with the engineering teams within Amazon developing these new capabilities.

Our Big Data Support team specializes in helping customers with streaming, storing and processing vast amounts of data in the Cloud. Our engineers focus on helping customers use and integrate services in what is arguably our industry’s most exciting space. The portfolio of services covers EMR (Hadoop), DynamoDB (NoSQL), ElasticSearch, Kinesis, Athena, ML/AI & more. We have a team of talented Support Engineers located in 8 countries around the world, and are growing rapidly. Our follow the sun support and shift model mean you will not be on-call.

Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
Learn and use groundbreaking technologies
Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs
Interact with leading technologists around the world
Work directly with Amazon Web Service architects to help reproduce and resolve customer issues
Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services.
Drive customer interactions. Phone, Chat, Emails, Screen shares and conference calls
Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience
Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the customer community
Work on critical, highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Proficient in Hadoop Map-Reduce and its Eco System [ Zookeeper, HBASE, HDFS, Pig, Hive, spark, etc].

Expert understanding of ETL principles and how to apply them within Hadoop

Python, and shell scripting; experience with Java a plus.

Exposure to Virtualization (VMware, Xen, Hypervisor)

Prior working experience with AWS - any or all of EC2, S3, EBS, ELB, RDS, Dynamo DB, EMR

Exposure to security concepts / best practices

Expertise with IPsec, VPN, Load Balancing, Iperf, MTR, Routing Protocols, SSH, Network Monitoring / Troubleshooting tools

Experience managing full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/ Age.
